member.summary: Occurs whenever a user authorizes an application. Sent to the related application only.

member.summary: Occurs whenever an application fee is refunded, whether from refunding a charge or from refunding the application fee directly, including partial refunds.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ApplicationFeeRefundUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever an application fee refund is updated.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.BalanceAvailable
member.summary: Occurs whenever your Stripe balance has been updated (e.g. when a charge collected is available to be paid out). By default, Stripe will automatically transfer any funds in your balance to your bank account on a daily basis.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.CapabilityUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever a capability has new requirements or a new status.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeCaptured

member.summary: Occurs whenever a previously uncaptured charge expires.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeFailed
member.summary: Occurs whenever a failed charge attempt occurs.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeSucceeded

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeUpdated
member.summary: Occurs whenever a charge description or metadata is updated.

member.summary: Occurs when funds are reinstated to your account after a dispute is closed. This includes partially refunded payments.

member.name: F:Stripe.Events.ChargeRefundUpdated

member.summary: The business type. One of: company, government_entity, individual, or non_profit.

member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.DetailsSubmitted
member.summary: Whether account details have been submitted. Standard accounts cannot receive payouts before this is true.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Email
member.summary: The primary user's email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.ExternalAccounts
member.summary: External accounts (bank accounts and debit cards) currently attached to this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Individual
member.summary:
This is an object representing a person associated with a Stripe account.
A platform cannot access a Standard or Express account's persons after the account starts onboarding, such as after generating an account link for the account. See the Standard onboarding or Express onboarding documentation for information about platform pre-filling and account onboarding steps.
Related guide: Handling Identity Verification with the API.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Account.PayoutsEnabled
member.summary: Whether Stripe can send payouts to this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompany.OwnersProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's owners have been provided. This Boolean will be true if you've manually indicated that all owners are provided via the owners_provided parameter, or if Stripe determined that sufficient owners were provided. Stripe determines ownership requirements using both the number of owners provided and their total percent ownership (calculated by adding the percent_ownership of each owner together).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: The date the fields in currently_due must be collected by to keep payouts enabled for the account. These fields might block payouts sooner if the next threshold is reached before these fields are collected.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected to keep the account enabled. If not collected by the current_deadline, these fields appear in past_due as well, and the account is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: If the account is disabled, this string describes why the account can’t create charges or receive payouts. Can be requirements.past_due, requirements.pending_verification, rejected.fraud, rejected.terms_of_service, rejected.listed, rejected.other, listed, under_review, or other.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.Errors
member.summary: The fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed for some reason.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, these fields appear in currently_due as well, and the current_deadline is set.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: The fields that weren't collected by the current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to re-enable the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. An empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, the fields in this array become required and move to currently_due or past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.BalanceTransaction.ExchangeRate
member.summary: The exchange rate used, if applicable, for this transaction. Specifically, if money was converted from currency A to currency B, then the amount in currency A, times exchange_rate, would be the amount in currency B. For example, suppose you charged a customer 10.00 EUR. Then the PaymentIntent's amount would be 1000 and currency would be eur. Suppose this was converted into 12.34 USD in your Stripe account. Then the BalanceTransaction's amount would be 1234, currency would be usd, and exchange_rate would be 1.234.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccount.Status
member.summary:
For bank accounts, possible values are new, validated, verified, verification_failed, or errored. A bank account that hasn't had any activity or validation performed is new. If Stripe can determine that the bank account exists, its status will be validated. Note that there often isn’t enough information to know (e.g., for smaller credit unions), and the validation is not always run. If customer bank account verification has succeeded, the bank account status will be verified. If the verification failed for any reason, such as microdeposit failure, the status will be verification_failed. If a transfer sent to this bank account fails, we'll set the status to errored and will not continue to send transfers until the bank details are updated.
For external accounts, possible values are new and errored. Validations aren't run against external accounts because they're only used for payouts. This means the other statuses don't apply. If a transfer fails, the status is set to errored and transfers are stopped until account details are updated.

member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account for which the capability enables functionality.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Requested
member.summary: Whether the capability has been requested.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.RequestedAt
member.summary: Time at which the capability was requested. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Capability.Status
member.summary: The status of the capability. Can be active, inactive, pending, or unrequested. One of: active, disabled, inactive, pending, or unrequested.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.CurrentDeadline
member.summary: The date the fields in currently_due must be collected by to keep the capability enabled for the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected to keep the capability enabled. If not collected by the current_deadline, these fields appear in past_due as well, and the capability is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: If the capability is disabled, this string describes why. Possible values are requirement.fields_needed, pending.onboarding, pending.review, rejected_fraud, or rejected.other.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.Errors
member.summary: The fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed for some reason.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: The fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As they become required, these fields appear in currently_due as well, and the current_deadline is set.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: The fields that weren't collected by the current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable the capability for the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. An empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, the fields in this array become required and move to currently_due or past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.CvcCheck
member.summary: If a CVC was provided, results of the check: pass, fail, unavailable, or unchecked. A result of unchecked indicates that CVC was provided but hasn't been checked yet. Checks are typically performed when attaching a card to a Customer object, or when creating a charge. For more details, see Check if a card is valid without a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Card.Fingerprint

For payment methods that tokenize card information (Apple Pay, Google Pay), the tokenized number might be provided instead of the underlying card number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Charge.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.summary: Assessments from Stripe. If set, the value is fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeFraudDetails.UserReport
member.summary: Assessments reported by you. If set, possible values of are safe and fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.NetworkStatus
member.summary: Possible values are approved_by_network, declined_by_network, not_sent_to_network, and reversed_after_approval. The value reversed_after_approval indicates the payment was blocked by Stripe after bank authorization, and may temporarily appear as "pending" on a cardholder's statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.Reason
member.summary: An enumerated value providing a more detailed explanation of the outcome's type. Charges blocked by Radar's default block rule have the value highest_risk_level. Charges placed in review by Radar's default review rule have the value elevated_risk_level. Charges authorized, blocked, or placed in review by custom rules have the value rule. See understanding declines for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RiskLevel
member.summary: Stripe Radar's evaluation of the riskiness of the payment. Possible values for evaluated payments are normal, elevated, highest. For non-card payments, and card-based payments predating the public assignment of risk levels, this field will have the value not_assessed. In the event of an error in the evaluation, this field will have the value unknown. This field is only available with Radar.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RiskScore
member.summary: Stripe Radar's evaluation of the riskiness of the payment. Possible values for evaluated payments are between 0 and 100. For non-card payments, card-based payments predating the public assignment of risk scores, or in the event of an error during evaluation, this field will not be present. This field is only available with Radar for Fraud Teams.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.RuleId
member.summary: (ID of the Radar.Rule) The ID of the Radar rule that matched the payment, if applicable.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.Rule
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the Radar rule that matched the payment, if applicable.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.SellerMessage
member.summary: A human-readable description of the outcome type and reason, designed for you (the recipient of the payment), not your customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeOutcome.Type
member.summary: Possible values are authorized, manual_review, issuer_declined, blocked, and invalid. See understanding declines and Radar reviews for details.

member.summary: The type of transaction-specific details of the payment method used in the payment, one of ach_credit_transfer, ach_debit, alipay, au_becs_debit, bancontact, card, card_present, eps, giropay, ideal, klarna, multibanco, p24, sepa_debit, sofort, stripe_account, or wechat. An additional hash is included on payment_method_details with a name matching this value. It contains information specific to the payment method.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CancelUrl
member.summary: The URL the customer will be directed to if they decide to cancel payment and return to your website.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.ClientReferenceId
member.summary: A unique string to reference the Checkout Session. This can be a customer ID, a cart ID, or similar, and can be used to reconcile the Session with your internal systems.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CustomerId
member.summary: (ID of the Customer) The ID of the customer for this Session. For Checkout Sessions in payment or subscription mode, Checkout will create a new customer object based on information provided during the payment flow unless an existing customer was provided when the Session was created.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the customer for this Session. For Checkout Sessions in payment or subscription mode, Checkout will create a new customer object based on information provided during the payment flow unless an existing customer was provided when the Session was created.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CustomerDetails
member.summary: The customer details including the customer's tax exempt status and the customer's tax IDs.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.CustomerEmail
member.summary: If provided, this value will be used when the Customer object is created. If not provided, customers will be asked to enter their email address. Use this parameter to prefill customer data if you already have an email on file. To access information about the customer once the payment flow is complete, use the customer attribute.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.LineItems
member.summary: The line items purchased by the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.Session.Livemode

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionDisplayItem.Amount
member.summary: Amount for the display item.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionDisplayItem.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionDisplayItem.Plan
member.summary:
You can now model subscriptions more flexibly using the Prices API. It replaces the Plans API and is backwards compatible to simplify your migration.
Plans define the base price, currency, and billing cycle for recurring purchases of products. Products help you track inventory or provisioning, and plans help you track pricing. Different physical goods or levels of service should be represented by products, and pricing options should be represented by plans. This approach lets you change prices without having to change your provisioning scheme.
For example, you might have a single "gold" product that has plans for $10/month, $100/year, €9/month, and €90/year.
Related guides: Set up a subscription and more about products and prices.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionDisplayItem.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity of the display item being purchased.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionDisplayItem.Sku
member.summary:
Stores representations of stock keeping units. SKUs describe specific product variations, taking into account any combination of: attributes, currency, and cost. For example, a product may be a T-shirt, whereas a specific SKU represents the size: large, color: red version of that shirt.
Can also be used to manage inventory.
Related guide: Tax, Shipping, and Inventory.

member.summary:
A discount represents the actual application of a coupon to a particular customer. It contains information about when the discount began and when it will end.
Related guide: Applying Discounts to Subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionTotalDetailsBreakdownTax.Rate
member.summary:
Tax rates can be applied to invoices, subscriptions and Checkout Sessions to collect tax.
Related guide: Tax Rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.AllowPromotionCodes
member.summary: Enables user redeemable promotion codes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.BillingAddressCollection
member.summary: Specify whether Checkout should collect the customer's billing address. One of: auto, or required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.CancelUrl
member.summary: The URL the customer will be directed to if they decide to cancel payment and return to your website.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.ClientReferenceId
member.summary: A unique string to reference the Checkout Session. This can be a customer ID, a cart ID, or similar, and can be used to reconcile the session with your internal systems.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: ID of an existing customer, if one exists. The email stored on the customer will be used to prefill the email field on the Checkout page. If the customer changes their email on the Checkout page, the Customer object will be updated with the new email. If blank for Checkout Sessions in payment or subscription mode, Checkout will create a new customer object based on information provided during the payment flow.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.CustomerEmail
member.summary: If provided, this value will be used when the Customer object is created. If not provided, customers will be asked to enter their email address. Use this parameter to prefill customer data if you already have an email on file. To access information about the customer once a session is complete, use the customer field.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The coupon or promotion code to apply to this Session. Currently, only up to one may be specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.LineItems
member.summary:
A list of items the customer is purchasing. Use this parameter to pass one-time or recurring Prices. One-time Prices in subscription mode will be on the initial invoice only.
There is a maximum of 100 line items, however it is recommended to consolidate line items if there are more than a few dozen.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Locale
member.summary: The IETF language tag of the locale Checkout is displayed in. If blank or auto, the browser's locale is used. One of: auto, bg, cs, da, de, el, en, en-GB, es, es-419, et, fi, fr, fr-CA, hu, id, it, ja, lt, lv, ms, mt, nb, nl, pl, pt, pt-BR, ro, ru, sk, sl, sv, tr, zh, zh-HK, or zh-TW.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.Mode
member.summary: The mode of the Checkout Session. Required when using prices or setup mode. Pass subscription if the Checkout Session includes at least one recurring item. One of: payment, setup, or subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.PaymentIntentData
member.summary: A subset of parameters to be passed to PaymentIntent creation for Checkout Sessions in payment mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary:
A list of the types of payment methods (e.g., card) this Checkout Session can accept.
Read more about the supported payment methods and their requirements in our payment method details guide.
If multiple payment methods are passed, Checkout will dynamically reorder them to prioritize the most relevant payment methods based on the customer's location and other characteristics.

member.summary: Describes the type of transaction being performed by Checkout in order to customize relevant text on the page, such as the submit button. submit_type can only be specified on Checkout Sessions in payment mode, but not Checkout Sessions in subscription or setup mode. One of: auto, book, donate, or pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.SubscriptionData
member.summary: A subset of parameters to be passed to subscription creation for Checkout Sessions in subscription mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionCreateOptions.SuccessUrl
member.summary: The URL to which Stripe should send customers when payment or setup is complete. If you’d like access to the Checkout Session for the successful payment, read more about it in the guide on fulfilling orders.

member.summary: The ID of the coupon to apply to this Session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionDiscountOptions.PromotionCode
member.summary: The ID of a promotion code to apply to this Session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount to be collected per unit of the line item. If specified, must also pass currency and name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency. Required if amount is passed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemOptions.Description
member.summary:
The description for the line item, to be displayed on the Checkout page.
If using price or price_data, will default to the name of the associated product.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemOptions.DynamicTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will be applied to this line item depending on the customer's billing/shipping address. We currently support the following countries: US, GB, AU, and all countries in the EU.

member.summary: A list of image URLs representing this line item. Each image can be up to 5 MB in size. If passing price or price_data, specify images on the associated product instead.

member.summary: The name for the item to be displayed on the Checkout page. Required if amount is passed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemOptions.Price

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline. One of price, price_data or amount is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: The quantity of the line item being purchased. Quantity should not be defined when recurring.usage_type=metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to this line item.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to. One of product or product_data is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataOptions.ProductData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new product object inline. One of product or product_data is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as interval and usage_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A non-negative integer in %s representing how much to charge. One of unit_amount or unit_amount_decimal is required.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in %s with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataProductDataOptions.Description
member.summary: The product's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store a long form explanation of the product being sold for your own rendering purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataProductDataOptions.Images
member.summary: A list of up to 8 URLs of images for this product, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataProductDataOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataProductDataOptions.Name
member.summary: The product's name, meant to be displayable to the customer. Whenever this product is sold via a subscription, name will show up on associated invoice line item descriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionLineItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account, using the Stripe-Account header or an OAuth key. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID for which these funds are intended. For details, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to. If receipt_email is specified for a payment in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with the payment method collected by this Checkout Session.
When setting this to on_session, Checkout will show a notice to the customer that their payment details will be saved.
When setting this to off_session, Checkout will show a notice to the customer that their payment details will be saved and used for future payments.
For both values, Checkout will attach the payment method to either the provided Customer for the session, or a new Customer created by Checkout if one has not been provided.
When processing card payments, Checkout also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: off_session, or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for this payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about the payment. This will appear on your customer's statement when this payment succeeds in creating a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment succeeds. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies the resulting payment as part of a group. See the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionPaymentIntentDataTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: If specified, successful charges will be attributed to the destination account for tax reporting, and the funds from charges will be transferred to the destination account. The ID of the resulting transfer will be returned on the successful charge's transfer field.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSetupIntentDataOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSetupIntentDataOptions.Metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSetupIntentDataOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account for which the setup is intended.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionShippingAddressCollectionOptions.AllowedCountries
member.summary: An array of two-letter ISO country codes representing which countries Checkout should provide as options for shipping locations. Unsupported country codes: AS, CX, CC, CU, HM, IR, KP, MH, FM, NF, MP, PW, SD, SY, UM, VI.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataItemOptions.Plan
member.summary: Plan ID for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: The quantity of the subscription item being purchased. Quantity should not be defined when recurring.usage_type=metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to this item. When set, the default_tax_rates on subscription_data do not apply to this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee percent, the request must be made on behalf of another account, using the Stripe-Account header or an OAuth key. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.Coupon
member.summary: The ID of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any subscription item that does not have tax_rates set. Invoices created will have their default_tax_rates populated from the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.Items
member.summary: A list of items, each with an attached plan, that the customer is subscribing to. Prefer using line_items.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: Unix timestamp representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time. Has to be at least 48 hours in the future.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a plan’s trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting trial_end on subscription_data is preferred. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Checkout.SessionSubscriptionDataOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Integer representing the number of trial period days before the customer is charged for the first time. Has to be at least 1.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object. Represented as the ISO country code for this country.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.DefaultCurrency
member.summary: The default currency for this country. This applies to both payment methods and bank accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.SupportedBankAccountCurrencies
member.summary: Currencies that can be accepted in the specific country (for transfers).

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.SupportedPaymentCurrencies
member.summary: Currencies that can be accepted in the specified country (for payments).

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.SupportedPaymentMethods
member.summary: Payment methods available in the specified country. You may need to enable some payment methods (e.g., ACH) on your account before they appear in this list. The stripe payment method refers to charging through your platform.

member.name: P:Stripe.CountrySpec.SupportedTransferCountries
member.summary: Countries that can accept transfers from the specified country.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.AmountOff
member.summary: Amount (in the currency specified) that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Currency
member.summary: If amount_off has been set, the three-letter ISO code for the currency of the amount to take off.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Duration
member.summary: One of forever, once, and repeating. Describes how long a customer who applies this coupon will get the discount. One of: forever, once, or repeating.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.DurationInMonths
member.summary: If duration is repeating, the number of months the coupon applies. Null if coupon duration is forever or once.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.MaxRedemptions
member.summary: Maximum number of times this coupon can be redeemed, in total, across all customers, before it is no longer valid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Name
member.summary: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on for instance invoices or receipts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.PercentOff
member.summary: Percent that will be taken off the subtotal of any invoices for this customer for the duration of the coupon. For example, a coupon with percent_off of 50 will make a %s100 invoice %s50 instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.RedeemBy
member.summary: Date after which the coupon can no longer be redeemed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.TimesRedeemed
member.summary: Number of times this coupon has been applied to a customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Coupon.Valid
member.summary: Taking account of the above properties, whether this coupon can still be applied to a customer.

member.summary: The customer's balance after the transaction was applied. A negative value decreases the amount due on the customer's next invoice. A positive value increases the amount due on the customer's next invoice.

member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerBalanceTransaction.Type
member.summary: Transaction type: adjustment, applied_to_invoice, credit_note, initial, invoice_too_large, invoice_too_small, unspent_receiver_credit, or unapplied_from_invoice. See the Customer Balance page to learn more about transaction types. One of: adjustment, applied_to_invoice, credit_note, initial, invoice_too_large, invoice_too_small, migration, unapplied_from_invoice, or unspent_receiver_credit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Address
member.summary: The customer's address.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Balance
member.summary: Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to their next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to their next invoice. The balance does not refer to any unpaid invoices; it solely takes into account amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. This balance is only taken into account as invoices are finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO code for the currency the customer can be charged in for recurring billing purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.DefaultSourceId
member.summary:
(ID of the IPaymentSource) ID of the default payment source for the customer.
If you are using payment methods created via the PaymentMethods API, see the invoice_settings.default_payment_method field instead.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.DefaultSource
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the default payment source for the customer.
If you are using payment methods created via the PaymentMethods API, see the invoice_settings.default_payment_method field instead.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Customer.Delinquent
member.summary:
When the customer's latest invoice is billed by charging automatically, delinquent is true if the invoice's latest charge failed. When the customer's latest invoice is billed by sending an invoice, delinquent is true if the invoice isn't paid by its due date.
If an invoice is marked uncollectible by dunning, delinquent doesn't get reset to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.IsChargeRefundable
member.summary: If true, it is still possible to refund the disputed payment. Once the payment has been fully refunded, no further funds will be withdrawn from your Stripe account as a result of this dispute.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Reason
member.summary: Reason given by cardholder for dispute. Possible values are bank_cannot_process, check_returned, credit_not_processed, customer_initiated, debit_not_authorized, duplicate, fraudulent, general, incorrect_account_details, insufficient_funds, product_not_received, product_unacceptable, subscription_canceled, or unrecognized. Read more about dispute reasons.

member.name: P:Stripe.Dispute.Status
member.summary: Current status of dispute. Possible values are warning_needs_response, warning_under_review, warning_closed, needs_response, under_review, charge_refunded, won, or lost. One of: charge_refunded, lost, needs_response, under_review, warning_closed, warning_needs_response, warning_under_review, or won.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.AccessActivityLog
member.summary: Any server or activity logs showing proof that the customer accessed or downloaded the purchased digital product. This information should include IP addresses, corresponding timestamps, and any detailed recorded activity.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.BillingAddress
member.summary: The billing address provided by the customer.

member.summary: (ID of the File) (ID of a file upload) Any communication with the customer that you feel is relevant to your case. Examples include emails proving that the customer received the product or service, or demonstrating their use of or satisfaction with the product or service.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.DuplicateChargeDocumentation

For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.DuplicateChargeExplanation
member.summary: An explanation of the difference between the disputed charge versus the prior charge that appears to be a duplicate.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.DuplicateChargeId
member.summary: The Stripe ID for the prior charge which appears to be a duplicate of the disputed charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ProductDescription

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ServiceDate

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ServiceDocumentationId
member.summary: (ID of the File) (ID of a file upload) Documentation showing proof that a service was provided to the customer. This could include a copy of a signed contract, work order, or other form of written agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ServiceDocumentation
member.summary:
(Expanded) (ID of a file upload) Documentation showing proof that a service was provided to the customer. This could include a copy of a signed contract, work order, or other form of written agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ShippingAddress
member.summary: The address to which a physical product was shipped. You should try to include as complete address information as possible.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ShippingCarrier
member.summary: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc. If multiple carriers were used for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ShippingDate
member.summary: The date on which a physical product began its route to the shipping address, in a clear human-readable format.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ShippingDocumentationId
member.summary: (ID of the File) (ID of a file upload) Documentation showing proof that a product was shipped to the customer at the same address the customer provided to you. This could include a copy of the shipment receipt, shipping label, etc. It should show the customer's full shipping address, if possible.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ShippingDocumentation
member.summary:
(Expanded) (ID of a file upload) Documentation showing proof that a product was shipped to the customer at the same address the customer provided to you. This could include a copy of the shipment receipt, shipping label, etc. It should show the customer's full shipping address, if possible.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidence.ShippingTrackingNumber
member.summary: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceDetails.SubmissionCount

member.name: P:Stripe.EventData.RawObject

member.name: P:Stripe.EventRequest.Id

member.name: P:Stripe.EventRequest.IdempotencyKey

member.summary: The country of the business associated with this invoice, most often the business creating the invoice.

member.summary: The public name of the business associated with this invoice, most often the business creating the invoice.

member.summary: (IDs of the AccountTaxIds) The account tax IDs associated with the invoice. Only editable when the invoice is a draft.

member.summary:
(Expanded) The account tax IDs associated with the invoice. Only editable when the invoice is a draft.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountDue
member.summary: Final amount due at this time for this invoice. If the invoice's total is smaller than the minimum charge amount, for example, or if there is account credit that can be applied to the invoice, the amount_due may be 0. If there is a positive starting_balance for the invoice (the customer owes money), the amount_due will also take that into account. The charge that gets generated for the invoice will be for the amount specified in amount_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountPaid
member.summary: The amount, in %s, that was paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AmountRemaining
member.summary: The amount remaining, in %s, that is due.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The fee in %s that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account when the invoice is paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AttemptCount
member.summary: Number of payment attempts made for this invoice, from the perspective of the payment retry schedule. Any payment attempt counts as the first attempt, and subsequently only automatic retries increment the attempt count. In other words, manual payment attempts after the first attempt do not affect the retry schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Attempted
member.summary: Whether an attempt has been made to pay the invoice. An invoice is not attempted until 1 hour after the invoice.created webhook, for example, so you might not want to display that invoice as unpaid to your users.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will perform automatic collection of the invoice. When false, the invoice's state will not automatically advance without an explicit action.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.BillingReason
member.summary: Indicates the reason why the invoice was created. subscription_cycle indicates an invoice created by a subscription advancing into a new period. subscription_create indicates an invoice created due to creating a subscription. subscription_update indicates an invoice created due to updating a subscription. subscription is set for all old invoices to indicate either a change to a subscription or a period advancement. manual is set for all invoices unrelated to a subscription (for example: created via the invoice editor). The upcoming value is reserved for simulated invoices per the upcoming invoice endpoint. subscription_threshold indicates an invoice created due to a billing threshold being reached. One of: automatic_pending_invoice_item_invoice, manual, subscription, subscription_create, subscription_cycle, subscription_threshold, subscription_update, or upcoming.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.ChargeId
member.summary: (ID of the Charge) ID of the latest charge generated for this invoice, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Charge
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the latest charge generated for this invoice, if any.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomFields
member.summary: Custom fields displayed on the invoice.

member.summary: (ID of the Customer) The ID of the customer who will be billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) The ID of the customer who will be billed.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerAddress
member.summary: The customer's address. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.address. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerEmail
member.summary: The customer's email. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.email. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerName
member.summary: The customer's name. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.name. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerPhone
member.summary: The customer's phone number. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.phone. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerShipping
member.summary: The customer's shipping information. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.shipping. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerTaxExempt
member.summary: The customer's tax exempt status. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will equal customer.tax_exempt. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated. One of: exempt, none, or reverse.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.CustomerTaxIds
member.summary: The customer's tax IDs. Until the invoice is finalized, this field will contain the same tax IDs as customer.tax_ids. Once the invoice is finalized, this field will no longer be updated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultPaymentMethodId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentMethod) ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultSourceId
member.summary: (ID of the IPaymentSource) ID of the default payment source for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default source, if any, or to the customer's default source.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultSource
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the default payment source for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default source, if any, or to the customer's default source.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates applied to this invoice, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. Referenced as 'memo' in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Discount
member.summary: Describes the current discount applied to this invoice, if there is one. Not populated if there are multiple discounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DiscountIds
member.summary: (IDs of the Discounts) The discounts applied to the invoice. Line item discounts are applied before invoice discounts. Use expand[]=discounts to expand each discount.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Discounts
member.summary:
(Expanded) The discounts applied to the invoice. Line item discounts are applied before invoice discounts. Use expand[]=discounts to expand each discount.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.DueDate
member.summary: The date on which payment for this invoice is due. This value will be null for invoices where collection_method=charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.EndingBalance
member.summary: Ending customer balance after the invoice is finalized. Invoices are finalized approximately an hour after successful webhook delivery or when payment collection is attempted for the invoice. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be null.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Footer
member.summary: Footer displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.HostedInvoiceUrl
member.summary: The URL for the hosted invoice page, which allows customers to view and pay an invoice. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be null.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.InvoicePdf
member.summary: The link to download the PDF for the invoice. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be null.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.LastFinalizationError
member.summary: The error encountered during the previous attempt to finalize the invoice. This field is cleared when the invoice is successfully finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Lines
member.summary: The individual line items that make up the invoice. lines is sorted as follows: invoice items in reverse chronological order, followed by the subscription, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.NextPaymentAttempt
member.summary: The time at which payment will next be attempted. This value will be null for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Number
member.summary: A unique, identifying string that appears on emails sent to the customer for this invoice. This starts with the customer's unique invoice_prefix if it is specified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Paid
member.summary: Whether payment was successfully collected for this invoice. An invoice can be paid (most commonly) with a charge or with credit from the customer's account balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentIntent) The PaymentIntent associated with this invoice. The PaymentIntent is generated when the invoice is finalized, and can then be used to pay the invoice. Note that voiding an invoice will cancel the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PaymentIntent
member.summary:
(Expanded) The PaymentIntent associated with this invoice. The PaymentIntent is generated when the invoice is finalized, and can then be used to pay the invoice. Note that voiding an invoice will cancel the PaymentIntent.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PeriodEnd
member.summary: End of the usage period during which invoice items were added to this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PeriodStart
member.summary: Start of the usage period during which invoice items were added to this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PostPaymentCreditNotesAmount
member.summary: Total amount of all post-payment credit notes issued for this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.PrePaymentCreditNotesAmount
member.summary: Total amount of all pre-payment credit notes issued for this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.ReceiptNumber
member.summary: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.StartingBalance
member.summary: Starting customer balance before the invoice is finalized. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be the current customer balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about an invoice for the customer's credit card statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Status
member.summary: The status of the invoice, one of draft, open, paid, uncollectible, or void. Learn more. One of: deleted, draft, open, paid, uncollectible, or void.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.SubscriptionId
member.summary: (ID of the Subscription) The subscription that this invoice was prepared for, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Subscription
member.summary:
(Expanded) The subscription that this invoice was prepared for, if any.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.SubscriptionProrationDate
member.summary: Only set for upcoming invoices that preview prorations. The time used to calculate prorations.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Subtotal
member.summary: Total of all subscriptions, invoice items, and prorations on the invoice before any invoice level discount or tax is applied. Item discounts are already incorporated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Tax
member.summary: The amount of tax on this invoice. This is the sum of all the tax amounts on this invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.Total
member.summary: Total after discounts and taxes.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.TotalDiscountAmounts
member.summary: The aggregate amounts calculated per discount across all line items.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.TotalTaxAmounts
member.summary: The aggregate amounts calculated per tax rate for all line items.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.TransferData
member.summary: The account (if any) the payment will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from the payment will be transferred to for the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Invoice.WebhooksDeliveredAt
member.summary: Invoices are automatically paid or sent 1 hour after webhooks are delivered, or until all webhook delivery attempts have been exhausted. This field tracks the time when webhooks for this invoice were successfully delivered. If the invoice had no webhooks to deliver, this will be set while the invoice is being created.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomerTaxId.Type
member.summary: The type of the tax ID, one of eu_vat, br_cnpj, br_cpf, gb_vat, nz_gst, au_abn, in_gst, no_vat, za_vat, ch_vat, mx_rfc, sg_uen, ru_inn, ru_kpp, ca_bn, hk_br, es_cif, tw_vat, th_vat, jp_cn, jp_rn, li_uid, my_itn, us_ein, kr_brn, ca_qst, my_sst, sg_gst, ae_trn, cl_tin, sa_vat, id_npwp, my_frp, or unknown. One of: ae_trn, au_abn, br_cnpj, br_cpf, ca_bn, ca_qst, ch_vat, cl_tin, es_cif, eu_vat, gb_vat, hk_br, id_npwp, in_gst, jp_cn, jp_rn, kr_brn, li_uid, mx_rfc, my_frp, my_itn, my_sst, no_vat, nz_gst, ru_inn, ru_kpp, sa_vat, sg_gst, sg_uen, th_vat, tw_vat, unknown, us_ein, or za_vat.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomerTaxId.Value
member.summary: The value of the tax ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomField.Name
member.summary: The name of the custom field.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomField.Value
member.summary: The value of the custom field.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettings.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration to provide to the invoice’s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettings.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) to provide to the invoice’s PaymentIntent. If not set, Stripe attempts to automatically determine the types to use by looking at the invoice’s default payment method, the subscription’s default payment method, the customer’s default payment method, and your invoice template settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptions.Bancontact
member.summary: If paying by bancontact, this sub-hash contains details about the Bancontact payment method options to pass to the invoice’s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptions.Card
member.summary: If paying by card, this sub-hash contains details about the Card payment method options to pass to the invoice’s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsBancontact.PreferredLanguage
member.summary: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to. One of: de, en, fr, or nl.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCard.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, or automatic.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceStatusTransitions.FinalizedAt
member.summary: The time that the invoice draft was finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceStatusTransitions.MarkedUncollectibleAt
member.summary: The time that the invoice was marked uncollectible.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceStatusTransitions.PaidAt
member.summary: The time that the invoice was paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceStatusTransitions.VoidedAt
member.summary: The time that the invoice was voided.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceThresholdReason.AmountGte
member.summary: The total invoice amount threshold boundary if it triggered the threshold invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceThresholdReason.ItemReasons
member.summary: Indicates which line items triggered a threshold invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceThresholdReasonItemReason.LineItemIds
member.summary: The IDs of the line items that triggered the threshold invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceThresholdReasonItemReason.UsageGte
member.summary: The quantity threshold boundary that applied to the given line item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferData.Amount
member.summary: The amount in %s that will be transferred to the destination account when the invoice is paid. By default, the entire amount is transferred to the destination.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferData.DestinationId
member.summary: (ID of the Account) The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferData.Destination
member.summary:
(Expanded) The account where funds from the payment will be transferred to upon payment success.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Amount
member.summary: The total amount that was authorized or rejected. This amount is in the card's currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.AmountDetails
member.summary: Detailed breakdown of amount components. These amounts are denominated in currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Approved
member.summary: Whether the authorization has been approved.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.AuthorizationMethod
member.summary: How the card details were provided. One of: chip, contactless, keyed_in, online, or swipe.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.BalanceTransactions
member.summary: List of balance transactions associated with this authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Card
member.summary: You can create physical or virtual cards that are issued to cardholders.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.CardholderId
member.summary: (ID of the Cardholder) The cardholder to whom this authorization belongs.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Cardholder
member.summary:
(Expanded) The cardholder to whom this authorization belongs.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.MerchantAmount
member.summary: The total amount that was authorized or rejected. This amount is in the merchant_currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.MerchantCurrency
member.summary: The currency that was presented to the cardholder for the authorization. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.PendingRequest
member.summary: The pending authorization request. This field will only be non-null during an issuing_authorization.request webhook.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.RequestHistory
member.summary: History of every time the authorization was approved/denied (whether approved/denied by you directly or by Stripe based on your spending_controls). If the merchant changes the authorization by performing an incremental authorization or partial capture, you can look at this field to see the previous states of the authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Status
member.summary: The current status of the authorization in its lifecycle. One of: closed, pending, or reversed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Transactions
member.summary: List of transactions associated with this authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Authorization.Wallet
member.summary: What, if any, digital wallet was used for this authorization. One of apple_pay, google_pay, or samsung_pay.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationAmountDetails.AtmFee
member.summary: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.Category
member.summary: A categorization of the seller's type of business. See our merchant categories guide for a list of possible values.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.City
member.summary: City where the seller is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.Country
member.summary: Country where the seller is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.Name
member.summary: Name of the seller.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.NetworkId
member.summary: Identifier assigned to the seller by the card brand.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.PostalCode
member.summary: Postal code where the seller is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationMerchantData.State
member.summary: State where the seller is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.Amount
member.summary: The additional amount Stripe will hold if the authorization is approved, in the card's currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.AmountDetails
member.summary: Detailed breakdown of amount components. These amounts are denominated in currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.IsAmountControllable
member.summary: If set true, you may provide amount to control how much to hold for the authorization.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.MerchantAmount
member.summary: The amount the merchant is requesting to be authorized in the merchant_currency. The amount is in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequest.MerchantCurrency
member.summary: The local currency the merchant is requesting to authorize.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationPendingRequestAmountDetails.AtmFee
member.summary: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Amount
member.summary: The authorization amount in your card's currency and in the smallest currency unit. Stripe held this amount from your account to fund the authorization if the request was approved.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.AmountDetails
member.summary: Detailed breakdown of amount components. These amounts are denominated in currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Approved
member.summary: Whether this request was approved.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.MerchantAmount
member.summary: The amount that was authorized at the time of this request. This amount is in the merchant_currency and in the smallest currency unit.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.MerchantCurrency
member.summary: The currency that was collected by the merchant and presented to the cardholder for the authorization. Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistory.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the approval or decline. One of: account_disabled, card_active, card_inactive, cardholder_inactive, cardholder_verification_required, insufficient_funds, not_allowed, spending_controls, suspected_fraud, verification_failed, webhook_approved, webhook_declined, or webhook_timeout.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationRequestHistoryAmountDetails.AtmFee
member.summary: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationVerificationData.AddressLine1Check
member.summary: Whether the cardholder provided an address first line and if it matched the cardholder’s billing.address.line1. One of: match, mismatch, or not_provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationVerificationData.AddressPostalCodeCheck
member.summary: Whether the cardholder provided a postal code and if it matched the cardholder’s billing.address.postal_code. One of: match, mismatch, or not_provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationVerificationData.CvcCheck
member.summary: Whether the cardholder provided a CVC and if it matched Stripe’s record. One of: match, mismatch, or not_provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.AuthorizationVerificationData.ExpiryCheck
member.summary: Whether the cardholder provided an expiry date and if it matched Stripe’s record. One of: match, mismatch, or not_provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderRequirements.DisabledReason
member.summary: If disabled_reason is present, all cards will decline authorizations with cardholder_verification_required reason. One of: listed, rejected.listed, or under_review.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Array of fields that need to be collected in order to verify and re-enable the cardholder.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderSpendingControls.AllowedCategories
member.summary: Array of strings containing categories of authorizations to allow. All other categories will be blocked. Cannot be set with blocked_categories.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderSpendingControls.BlockedCategories
member.summary: Array of strings containing categories of authorizations to decline. All other categories will be allowed. Cannot be set with allowed_categories.

member.summary: Limit spending with amount-based rules that apply across this cardholder's cards.

member.summary: Currency of the amounts within spending_limits.

member.summary: Maximum amount allowed to spend per interval.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.CardholderSpendingControlsSpendingLimit.Interval

An Issuing Cardholder object represents an individual or business entity who is issued cards.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Cvc
member.summary: The card's CVC. For security reasons, this is only available for virtual cards, and will be omitted unless you explicitly request it with the expand parameter. Additionally, it's only available via the "Retrieve a card" endpoint, not via "List all cards" or any other endpoint.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.ExpMonth
member.summary: The expiration month of the card.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.ExpYear

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Issuing.Card.Number
member.summary: The full unredacted card number. For security reasons, this is only available for virtual cards, and will be omitted unless you explicitly request it with the expand parameter. Additionally, it's only available via the "Retrieve a card" endpoint, not via "List all cards" or any other endpoint.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthDeauthorize.StripeUserId
member.summary: The unique id of the account you have revoked access to, as a string. This is the same as the you passed in. If this is returned, the revocation was successful.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.AccessToken

summary.para: The access token you can use to make requests on behalf of this Stripe account. Use it as you would any Stripe secret API key.
This key does not expire, but may be revoked by the user at any time (you'll get a account.application.deauthorized webhook event when this happens).

member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In backend code, it is recommended that you use your own secret key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

summary.para: The live mode indicator for the token. If true, the can be used as a live secret key. If false, the can be used as a test secret key.
Depends on the mode of the secret API key used to make the request.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.RefreshToken
member.summary: Can be used to get a new access token of an equal or lesser scope, or of a different live mode (where applicable).
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In backend code, it is recommended that you don't use access tokens or refresh tokens at all. Instead, you should use your own secret key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.Scope
member.summary: The scope granted to the access token, depending on the scope of the authorization code and scope parameter.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.StripePublishableKey
member.summary: A publishable key that can be used with this account. Matches the mode—live or test—of the token.
member.remarks: This property is deprecated. In frontend code, it is recommended that you use your own publishable key in conjunction with the connected account's ID found in .

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.StripeUserId
member.summary: The unique id of the account you have been granted access to, as a string.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthToken.TokenType
member.summary: Will always have a value of bearer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.AmountCapturable
member.summary: Amount that can be captured from this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.AmountReceived
member.summary: Amount that was collected by this PaymentIntent.
