member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CanceledAt
member.summary: Populated when status is canceled, this is the time at which the PaymentIntent was canceled. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CancellationReason
member.summary: Reason for cancellation of this PaymentIntent, either user-provided (duplicate, fraudulent, requested_by_customer, or abandoned) or generated by Stripe internally (failed_invoice, void_invoice, or automatic). One of: abandoned, automatic, duplicate, failed_invoice, fraudulent, requested_by_customer, or void_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CaptureMethod
member.summary: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Charges
member.summary: Charges that were created by this PaymentIntent, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.ClientSecret
member.summary:
The client secret of this PaymentIntent. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.
The client secret can be used to complete a payment from your frontend. It should not be stored, logged, embedded in URLs, or exposed to anyone other than the customer. Make sure that you have TLS enabled on any page that includes the client secret.
Refer to our docs to accept a payment and learn about how client_secret should be handled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.CustomerId
member.summary:
(ID of the Customer) ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.
If present in combination with setup_future_usage, this PaymentIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.Customer
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.
If present in combination with setup_future_usage, this PaymentIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntent.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: off_session, or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCard.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic or any. If not provided, defaults to automatic. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, automatic, or challenge_only.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferData.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.summary: Whether the person's id_number was provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.LastName
member.summary: The person's last name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.LastNameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the person's last name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.LastNameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the person's last name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.MaidenName
member.summary: The person's maiden name.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Nationality
member.summary: The country where the person is a national.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Phone
member.summary: The person's phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.PoliticalExposure
member.summary: Indicates if the person or any of their representatives, family members, or other closely related persons, declares that they hold or have held an important public job or function, in any jurisdiction. One of: existing, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.Requirements
member.summary: Information about the requirements for this person, including what information needs to be collected, and by when.

member.name: P:Stripe.Person.SsnLast4Provided
member.summary: Whether the last four digits of the person's Social Security number have been provided (U.S. only).

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Director
member.summary: Whether the person is a director of the account's legal entity. Currently only required for accounts in the EU. Directors are typically members of the governing board of the company, or responsible for ensuring the company meets its regulatory obligations.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Executive
member.summary: Whether the person has significant responsibility to control, manage, or direct the organization.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Owner
member.summary: Whether the person is an owner of the account’s legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.PercentOwnership
member.summary: The percent owned by the person of the account's legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Representative
member.summary: Whether the person is authorized as the primary representative of the account. This is the person nominated by the business to provide information about themselves, and general information about the account. There can only be one representative at any given time. At the time the account is created, this person should be set to the person responsible for opening the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationship.Title
member.summary: The person's title (e.g., CEO, Support Engineer).

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.CurrentlyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected to keep the person's account enabled. If not collected by the account's current_deadline, these fields appear in past_due as well, and the account is disabled.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.Errors
member.summary: The fields that are currently_due and need to be collected again because validation or verification failed for some reason.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.EventuallyDue
member.summary: Fields that need to be collected assuming all volume thresholds are reached. As fields are needed, they are moved to currently_due and the account's current_deadline is set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.PastDue
member.summary: Fields that weren't collected by the account's current_deadline. These fields need to be collected to enable payouts for the person's account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirements.PendingVerification
member.summary: Fields that may become required depending on the results of verification or review. An empty array unless an asynchronous verification is pending. If verification fails, the fields in this array become required and move to currently_due or past_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirementsError.Code
member.summary: The code for the type of error. One of: invalid_address_city_state_postal_code, invalid_street_address, invalid_value_other, verification_document_address_mismatch, verification_document_address_missing, verification_document_corrupt, verification_document_country_not_supported, verification_document_dob_mismatch, verification_document_duplicate_type, verification_document_expired, verification_document_failed_copy, verification_document_failed_greyscale, verification_document_failed_other, verification_document_failed_test_mode, verification_document_fraudulent, verification_document_id_number_mismatch, verification_document_id_number_missing, verification_document_incomplete, verification_document_invalid, verification_document_issue_or_expiry_date_missing, verification_document_manipulated, verification_document_missing_back, verification_document_missing_front, verification_document_name_mismatch, verification_document_name_missing, verification_document_nationality_mismatch, verification_document_not_readable, verification_document_not_signed, verification_document_not_uploaded, verification_document_photo_mismatch, verification_document_too_large, verification_document_type_not_supported, verification_failed_address_match, verification_failed_business_iec_number, verification_failed_document_match, verification_failed_id_number_match, verification_failed_keyed_identity, verification_failed_keyed_match, verification_failed_name_match, verification_failed_other, verification_failed_tax_id_match, or verification_failed_tax_id_not_issued.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirementsError.Reason
member.summary: An informative message that indicates the error type and provides additional details about the error.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRequirementsError.Requirement
member.summary: The specific user onboarding requirement field (in the requirements hash) that needs to be resolved.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerification.AdditionalDocument
member.summary: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

member.summary: A user-displayable string describing the verification state for the person. For example, this may say "Provided identity information could not be verified".

member.summary: One of document_address_mismatch, document_dob_mismatch, document_duplicate_type, document_id_number_mismatch, document_name_mismatch, document_nationality_mismatch, failed_keyed_identity, or failed_other. A machine-readable code specifying the verification state for the person.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerification.Status
member.summary: The state of verification for the person. Possible values are unverified, pending, or verified.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan can be used for new purchases.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for plans of usage_type=metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum. One of: last_during_period, last_ever, max, or sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Amount
member.summary: The unit amount in %s to be charged, represented as a whole integer if possible.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.AmountDecimal
member.summary: The unit amount in %s to be charged, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in amount) will be charged per unit in quantity (for plans with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for plans with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes. One of: per_unit, or tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Deleted
member.summary: Whether this object is deleted or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Interval
member.summary: The frequency at which a subscription is billed. One of day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals (specified in the interval attribute) between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.ProductId
member.summary: (ID of the Product) The product whose pricing this plan determines.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Product
member.summary:
(Expanded) The product whose pricing this plan determines.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires billing_scheme to be set to tiered. See also the documentation for billing_scheme.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price. In graduated tiering, pricing can change as the quantity grows. One of: graduated, or volume.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TransformUsage
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the amount billed. Cannot be combined with tiers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.Plan.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed. One of: licensed, or metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.FlatAmount
member.summary: Price for the entire tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.FlatAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as flat_amount, but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UnitAmount
member.summary: Per unit price for units relevant to the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but contains a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTier.UpTo
member.summary: Up to and including to this quantity will be contained in the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTransformUsage.DivideBy
member.summary: Divide usage by this number.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTransformUsage.Round
member.summary: After division, either round the result up or down. One of: down, or up.

member.summary: A list of up to 5 attributes that each SKU can provide values for (e.g., ["color", "size"]).

member.summary: A short one-line description of the product, meant to be displayable to the customer. Only applicable to products of type=good.

member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.summary: The product's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store a long form explanation of the product being sold for your own rendering purposes.

member.summary: A list of up to 8 URLs of images for this product, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Product.PackageDimensions
member.summary: The dimensions of this product for shipping purposes. A SKU associated with this product can override this value by having its own package_dimensions. Only applicable to products of type=good.

member.summary: Whether this product is a shipped good. Only applicable to products of type=good.

member.name: P:Stripe.Product.StatementDescriptor

member.name: P:Stripe.Product.Type
member.summary: The type of the product. The product is either of type good, which is eligible for use with Orders and SKUs, or service, which is eligible for use with Subscriptions and Plans. One of: good, or service.

member.name: P:Stripe.Product.UnitLabel

member.summary: The identifier of the value list this item belongs to.

member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.summary: The type of items in the value list. One of card_fingerprint, card_bin, email, ip_address, country, string, or case_sensitive_string. One of: card_bin, card_fingerprint, case_sensitive_string, country, email, ip_address, or string.

member.summary: The name of the value list.

member.summary: The value of the item (whose type must match the type of the parent value list).

member.name: P:Stripe.Radar.ValueListCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.summary: The human-readable name of the value list.

member.summary: The human-readable name of the value list.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Amount
member.summary: Amount, in %s.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.BalanceTransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the BalanceTransaction) Balance transaction that describes the impact on your account balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.BalanceTransaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) Balance transaction that describes the impact on your account balance.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.ChargeId
member.summary: (ID of the Charge) ID of the charge that was refunded.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Charge
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the charge that was refunded.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. (Available on non-card refunds only).

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.FailureBalanceTransactionId
member.summary: (ID of the BalanceTransaction) If the refund failed, this balance transaction describes the adjustment made on your account balance that reverses the initial balance transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.FailureBalanceTransaction
member.summary:
(Expanded) If the refund failed, this balance transaction describes the adjustment made on your account balance that reverses the initial balance transaction.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.FailureReason
member.summary: If the refund failed, the reason for refund failure if known. Possible values are lost_or_stolen_card, expired_or_canceled_card, or unknown.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.PaymentIntentId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentIntent) ID of the PaymentIntent that was refunded.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.PaymentIntent
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the PaymentIntent that was refunded.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Reason
member.summary: Reason for the refund, either user-provided (duplicate, fraudulent, or requested_by_customer) or generated by Stripe internally (expired_uncaptured_charge).

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.ReceiptNumber
member.summary: This is the transaction number that appears on email receipts sent for this refund.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.SourceTransferReversalId
member.summary: (ID of the TransferReversal) The transfer reversal that is associated with the refund. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.SourceTransferReversal
member.summary:
(Expanded) The transfer reversal that is associated with the refund. Only present if the charge came from another Stripe account. See the Connect documentation for details.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.Status
member.summary: Status of the refund. For credit card refunds, this can be pending, succeeded, or failed. For other types of refunds, it can be pending, succeeded, failed, or canceled. Refer to our refunds documentation for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.TransferReversalId
member.summary: (ID of the TransferReversal) If the accompanying transfer was reversed, the transfer reversal object. Only applicable if the charge was created using the destination parameter.

member.name: P:Stripe.Refund.TransferReversal
member.summary:
(Expanded) If the accompanying transfer was reversed, the transfer reversal object. Only applicable if the charge was created using the destination parameter.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Error
member.summary: If something should go wrong during the run, a message about the failure (populated when status=failed).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Livemode
member.summary: Always true: reports can only be run on live-mode data.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.ReportType
member.summary: The ID of the report type to run, such as "balance.summary.1".

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Result
member.summary: The file object representing the result of the report run (populated when status=succeeded).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.Status
member.summary: Status of this report run. This will be pending when the run is initially created. When the run finishes, this will be set to succeeded and the result field will be populated. Rarely, we may encounter an error, at which point this will be set to failed and the error field will be populated.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRun.SucceededAt
member.summary: Timestamp at which this run successfully finished (populated when status=succeeded). Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.Columns
member.summary: The set of output columns requested for inclusion in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.ConnectedAccount
member.summary: Connected account ID by which to filter the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.Currency
member.summary: Currency of objects to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.IntervalEnd
member.summary: Ending timestamp of data to be included in the report run (exclusive).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.IntervalStart
member.summary: Starting timestamp of data to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.Payout
member.summary: Payout ID by which to filter the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.ReportingCategory
member.summary: Category of balance transactions to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParameters.Timezone
member.summary: Defaults to Etc/UTC. The output timezone for all timestamps in the report. A list of possible time zone values is maintained at the IANA Time Zone Database. Has no effect on interval_start or interval_end.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Id
member.summary: The ID of the Report Type, such as balance.summary.1.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.DataAvailableEnd
member.summary: Most recent time for which this Report Type is available. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.DataAvailableStart
member.summary: Earliest time for which this Report Type is available. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.DefaultColumns
member.summary: List of column names that are included by default when this Report Type gets run. (If the Report Type doesn't support the columns parameter, this will be null.).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Name
member.summary: Human-readable name of the Report Type.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Updated
member.summary: When this Report Type was latest updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportType.Version
member.summary: Version of the Report Type. Different versions report with the same ID will have the same purpose, but may take different run parameters or have different result schemas.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunCreateOptions.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters specifying how the report should be run. Different Report Types have different required and optional parameters, listed in the API Access to Reports documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunCreateOptions.ReportType
member.summary: The ID of the report type to run, such as "balance.summary.1".

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.Columns
member.summary: The set of report columns to include in the report output. If omitted, the Report Type is run with its default column set.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.ConnectedAccount
member.summary: Connected account ID to filter for in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.Currency
member.summary: Currency of objects to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.IntervalEnd
member.summary: Ending timestamp of data to be included in the report run (exclusive).

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.IntervalStart
member.summary: Starting timestamp of data to be included in the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.Payout
member.summary: Payout ID by which to filter the report run.

member.name: P:Stripe.Reporting.ReportRunParametersOptions.ReportingCategory
member.summary: Category of balance transactions to be included in the report run. One of: advance, advance_funding, anticipation_repayment, charge, charge_failure, connect_collection_transfer, connect_reserved_funds, contribution, dispute, dispute_reversal, fee, financing_paydown, financing_paydown_reversal, financing_payout, financing_payout_reversal, issuing_authorization_hold, issuing_authorization_release, issuing_dispute, issuing_transaction, network_cost, other_adjustment, partial_capture_reversal, payout, payout_reversal, platform_earning, platform_earning_refund, refund, refund_failure, risk_reserved_funds, tax, topup, topup_reversal, transfer, or transfer_reversal.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.ClientSecret
member.summary:
The client secret of this SetupIntent. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.
The client secret can be used to complete payment setup from your frontend. It should not be stored, logged, embedded in URLs, or exposed to anyone other than the customer. Make sure that you have TLS enabled on any page that includes the client secret.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntent.Usage
member.summary:
Indicates how the payment method is intended to be used in the future.
Use on_session if you intend to only reuse the payment method when the customer is in your checkout flow. Use off_session if your customer may or may not be in your checkout flow. If not provided, this value defaults to off_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentNextAction.Type
member.summary: Type of the next action to perform, one of redirect_to_url, use_stripe_sdk, alipay_handle_redirect, or oxxo_display_details.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentNextActionRedirectToUrl.ReturnUrl
member.summary: If the customer does not exit their browser while authenticating, they will be redirected to this specified URL after completion.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentNextActionRedirectToUrl.Url
member.summary: The URL you must redirect your customer to in order to authenticate.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCard.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic or any. If not provided, defaults to automatic. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, automatic, or challenge_only.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the object.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Object
member.summary: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents for $1.00, or 1 for ¥1, Japanese Yen being a zero-decimal currency) representing the total amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single_use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the source. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Created
member.summary: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO code for the currency associated with the source. This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single_use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the customer to which this source is attached. This will not be present when the source has not been attached to a customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Flow
member.summary: The authentication flow of the source. flow is one of redirect, receiver, code_verification, none.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Livemode
member.summary: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Owner
member.summary: Information about the owner of the payment instrument that may be used or required by particular source types.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a source. This will appear on your customer's statement every time you charge the source.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Status
member.summary: The status of the source, one of canceled, chargeable, consumed, failed, or pending. Only chargeable sources can be used to create a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Type
member.summary: The type of the source. The type is a payment method, one of ach_credit_transfer, ach_debit, alipay, bancontact, card, card_present, eps, giropay, ideal, multibanco, klarna, p24, sepa_debit, sofort, three_d_secure, or wechat. An additional hash is included on the source with a name matching this value. It contains additional information specific to the payment method used. One of: ach_credit_transfer, ach_debit, acss_debit, alipay, au_becs_debit, bancontact, card, card_present, eps, giropay, ideal, klarna, multibanco, p24, sepa_credit_transfer, sepa_debit, sofort, three_d_secure, or wechat.

member.name: P:Stripe.Source.Usage
member.summary: Either reusable or single_use. Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while others may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCodeVerification.AttemptsRemaining
member.summary: The number of attempts remaining to authenticate the source object with a verification code.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceCodeVerification.Status
member.summary: The status of the code verification, either pending (awaiting verification, attempts_remaining should be greater than 0), succeeded (successful verification) or failed (failed verification, cannot be verified anymore as attempts_remaining should be 0).

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.Address
member.summary: Owner's address.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.Email
member.summary: Owner's email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.Name
member.summary: Owner's full name.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.Phone
member.summary: Owner's phone number (including extension).

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.VerifiedAddress
member.summary: Verified owner's address. Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.VerifiedEmail
member.summary: Verified owner's email address. Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.VerifiedName
member.summary: Verified owner's full name. Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceOwner.VerifiedPhone
member.summary: Verified owner's phone number (including extension). Verified values are verified or provided by the payment method directly (and if supported) at the time of authorization or settlement. They cannot be set or mutated.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.Address
member.summary: The address of the receiver source. This is the value that should be communicated to the customer to send their funds to.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountCharged
member.summary: The total amount that was moved to your balance. This is almost always equal to the amount charged. In rare cases when customers deposit excess funds and we are unable to refund those, those funds get moved to your balance and show up in amount_charged as well. The amount charged is expressed in the source's currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountReceived
member.summary: The total amount received by the receiver source. amount_received = amount_returned + amount_charged should be true for consumed sources unless customers deposit excess funds. The amount received is expressed in the source's currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.AmountReturned
member.summary: The total amount that was returned to the customer. The amount returned is expressed in the source's currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.RefundAttributesMethod
member.summary: Type of refund attribute method, one of email, manual, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceReceiver.RefundAttributesStatus
member.summary: Type of refund attribute status, one of missing, requested, or available.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceRedirect.FailureReason
member.summary: The failure reason for the redirect, either user_abort (the customer aborted or dropped out of the redirect flow), declined (the authentication failed or the transaction was declined), or processing_error (the redirect failed due to a technical error). Present only if the redirect status is failed.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceRedirect.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL you provide to redirect the customer to after they authenticated their payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceRedirect.Status
member.summary: The status of the redirect, either pending (ready to be used by your customer to authenticate the transaction), succeeded (succesful authentication, cannot be reused) or not_required (redirect should not be used) or failed (failed authentication, cannot be reused).

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceRedirect.Url
member.summary: The URL provided to you to redirect a customer to as part of a redirect authentication flow.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrder.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents for $1.00, or 1 for ¥1, Japanese Yen being a zero-decimal currency) representing the total amount for the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrder.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrder.Email
member.summary: The email address of the customer placing the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrder.Items
member.summary: List of items constituting the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItem.Amount
member.summary: The amount (price) for this order item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItem.Currency
member.summary: This currency of this order item. Required when amount is present.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItem.Description
member.summary: Human-readable description for this order item.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItem.Parent
member.summary: The ID of the associated object for this line item. Expandable if not null (e.g., expandable to a SKU).

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItem.Quantity
member.summary: The quantity of this order item. When type is sku, this is the number of instances of the SKU to be ordered.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceSourceOrderItem.Type
member.summary: The type of this order item. Must be sku, tax, or shipping.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeError.Charge
member.summary: For card errors, the ID of the failed charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeError.Code
member.summary: For some errors that could be handled programmatically, a short string indicating the error code reported.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeError.DeclineCode
member.summary: For card errors resulting from a card issuer decline, a short string indicating the card issuer's reason for the decline.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeError.DocUrl
member.summary: A URL to more information about the error code reported.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeError.Message

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeError.Param
member.summary: If the error is parameter-specific, the parameter related to the error. For example, you can use this to display a message near the correct form field.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItem.Plan
member.summary:
You can now model subscriptions more flexibly using the Prices API. It replaces the Plans API and is backwards compatible to simplify your migration.
Plans define the base price, currency, and billing cycle for recurring purchases of products. Products help you track inventory or provisioning, and plans help you track pricing. Different physical goods or levels of service should be represented by products, and pricing options should be represented by plans. This approach lets you change prices without having to change your provisioning scheme.
For example, you might have a single "gold" product that has plans for $10/month, $100/year, €9/month, and €90/year.
Related guides: Set up a subscription and more about products and prices.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionItem.Price
member.summary:
Prices define the unit cost, currency, and (optional) billing cycle for both recurring and one-time purchases of products. Products help you track inventory or provisioning, and prices help you track payment terms. Different physical goods or levels of service should be represented by products, and pricing options should be represented by prices. This approach lets you change prices without having to change your provisioning scheme.
For example, you might have a single "gold" product that has prices for $10/month, $100/year, and €9 once.
Related guides: Set up a subscription, create an invoice, and more about products and prices.

member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner's Stripe account during this phase of the schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.BillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Possible values are phase_start or automatic. If phase_start then billing cycle anchor of the subscription is set to the start of the phase when entering the phase. If automatic then the billing cycle anchor is automatically modified as needed when entering the phase. For more information, see the billing cycle documentation. One of: automatic, or phase_start.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionScheduleDefaultSettings.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay the underlying subscription at the end of each billing cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.summary: Indicates if the billing_cycle_anchor should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_cycle_anchor will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged. This value may not be true if the subscription contains items with plans that have aggregate_usage=last_ever.

member.summary: Determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.

member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.CancelAt
member.summary: A date in the future at which the subscription will automatically get canceled.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.CancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: If the subscription has been canceled with the at_period_end flag set to true, cancel_at_period_end on the subscription will be true. You can use this attribute to determine whether a subscription that has a status of active is scheduled to be canceled at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.CanceledAt
member.summary: If the subscription has been canceled, the date of that cancellation. If the subscription was canceled with cancel_at_period_end, canceled_at will reflect the time of the most recent update request, not the end of the subscription period when the subscription is automatically moved to a canceled state.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: Number of days a customer has to pay invoices generated by this subscription. This value will be null for subscriptions where collection_method=charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.DefaultPaymentMethodId
member.summary: (ID of the PaymentMethod) ID of the default payment method for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription. This takes precedence over default_source. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the default payment method for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription. This takes precedence over default_source. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.DefaultSourceId
member.summary: (ID of the IPaymentSource) ID of the default payment source for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription and be in a chargeable state. If default_payment_method is also set, default_payment_method will take precedence. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.DefaultSource
member.summary:
(Expanded) ID of the default payment source for the subscription. It must belong to the customer associated with the subscription and be in a chargeable state. If default_payment_method is also set, default_payment_method will take precedence. If neither are set, invoices will use the customer's invoice_settings.default_payment_method or default_source.
For more information, see the expand documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any subscription item that does not have tax_rates set. Invoices created will have their default_tax_rates populated from the subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.Discount
member.summary: Describes the current discount applied to this subscription, if there is one. When billing, a discount applied to a subscription overrides a discount applied on a customer-wide basis.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.NextPendingInvoiceItemInvoice

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.PauseCollection
member.summary: If specified, payment collection for this subscription will be paused.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.PendingInvoiceItemInterval
member.summary: Specifies an interval for how often to bill for any pending invoice items. It is analogous to calling Create an invoice for the given subscription at the specified interval.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.PendingSetupIntentId
member.summary: (ID of the SetupIntent) You can use this SetupIntent to collect user authentication when creating a subscription without immediate payment or updating a subscription's payment method, allowing you to optimize for off-session payments. Learn more in the SCA Migration Guide.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.StartDate
member.summary: Date when the subscription was first created. The date might differ from the created date due to backdating.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.Status
member.summary:
Possible values are incomplete, incomplete_expired, trialing, active, past_due, canceled, or unpaid.
For collection_method=charge_automatically a subscription moves into incomplete if the initial payment attempt fails. A subscription in this state can only have metadata and default_source updated. Once the first invoice is paid, the subscription moves into an active state. If the first invoice is not paid within 23 hours, the subscription transitions to incomplete_expired. This is a terminal state, the open invoice will be voided and no further invoices will be generated.
A subscription that is currently in a trial period is trialing and moves to active when the trial period is over.
If subscription collection_method=charge_automatically it becomes past_due when payment to renew it fails and canceled or unpaid (depending on your subscriptions settings) when Stripe has exhausted all payment retry attempts.
If subscription collection_method=send_invoice it becomes past_due when its invoice is not paid by the due date, and canceled or unpaid if it is still not paid by an additional deadline after that. Note that when a subscription has a status of unpaid, no subsequent invoices will be attempted (invoices will be created, but then immediately automatically closed). After receiving updated payment information from a customer, you may choose to reopen and pay their closed invoices. One of: active, canceled, incomplete, incomplete_expired, past_due, trialing, or unpaid.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.TransferData
member.summary: The account (if any) the subscription's payments will be attributed to for tax reporting, and where funds from each payment will be transferred to for each of the subscription's invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.TrialEnd
member.summary: If the subscription has a trial, the end of that trial.

member.name: P:Stripe.Subscription.TrialStart
member.summary: If the subscription has a trial, the beginning of that trial.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingThresholds.AmountGte
member.summary: Monetary threshold that triggers the subscription to create an invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionBillingThresholds.ResetBillingCycleAnchor
member.summary: Indicates if the billing_cycle_anchor should be reset when a threshold is reached. If true, billing_cycle_anchor will be updated to the date/time the threshold was last reached; otherwise, the value will remain unchanged. This value may not be true if the subscription contains items with plans that have aggregate_usage=last_ever.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPauseCollection.Behavior
member.summary: The payment collection behavior for this subscription while paused. One of keep_as_draft, mark_uncollectible, or void. One of: keep_as_draft, mark_uncollectible, or void.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPauseCollection.ResumesAt

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingInvoiceItemInterval.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between invoices. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.summary: If the update is applied, determines the date of the first full invoice, and, for plans with month or year intervals, the day of the month for subsequent invoices.

member.summary: The point after which the changes reflected by this update will be discarded and no longer applied.

member.summary: Unix timestamp representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time, if the update is applied.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionPendingUpdate.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Indicates if a plan's trial_period_days should be applied to the subscription. Setting trial_end per subscription is preferred, and this defaults to false. Setting this flag to true together with trial_end is not allowed.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.BankAccount
member.summary:
These bank accounts are payment methods on Customer objects.
On the other hand External Accounts are transfer destinations on Account objects for Custom accounts. They can be bank accounts or debit cards as well, and are documented in the links above.
Related guide: Bank Debits and Transfers.

member.name: P:Stripe.Token.Card
member.summary:
You can store multiple cards on a customer in order to charge the customer later. You can also store multiple debit cards on a recipient in order to transfer to those cards later.
Related guide: Card Payments with Sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.Topup.Source
member.summary:
Source objects allow you to accept a variety of payment methods. They represent a customer's payment instrument, and can be used with the Stripe API just like a Card object: once chargeable, they can be charged, or can be attached to customers.
Related guides: Sources API and Sources & Customers.

member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given instance.

The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsOptions(Stripe.INestedOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given options class. If a key prefix is provided, the keys for the new parameters will be nested under the key prefix. E.g. if the key prefix `foo` is passed and the options class contains a parameter `bar`, then a parameter with key `foo[bar]` will be returned.
member.param: The options class for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsDictionary(System.Collections.IDictionary,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given dictionary. If a key prefix is provided, the keys for the new parameters will be nested under the key prefix. E.g. if the key prefix `foo` is passed and the dictionary contains a key `bar`, then a parameter with key `foo[bar]` will be returned.
member.param: The dictionary for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested, if any.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.FlattenParamsList(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of parameters for a given list of objects. The parameter keys will be indexed under the `keyPrefix` parameter. E.g. if the `keyPrefix` is `foo`, then the key for the first element's will be `foo[0]`, etc.
member.param: The list for which to create the list of parameters.
The key under which new keys should be nested.
member.returns: The list of parameters.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.SingleParam(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a list containing a single parameter.
member.returns: A list containg the single parameter.

member.name: M:Stripe.Infrastructure.FormEncoding.FormEncoder.NewPrefix(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Computes the new key prefix, given a key and an existing prefix (if any). E.g. if the key is `bar` and the existing prefix is `foo`, then `foo[bar]` is returned. If a key already contains nested values, then only the non-nested part is nested under the prefix, e.g. if the key is `bar[baz]` and the prefix is `foo`, then `foo[bar][baz]` is returned. If no prefix is provided, the key is returned unchanged.
member.param: The existing key prefix, if any.
member.returns: The new key prefix.

member.summary: This converter is used to deserialize event objects regardless of which API version they're formatted with. In the general case, Stripe.net uses a specific API version (), but events are a special case: when receiving an event object via a webhook notification, the object will be formatted with the Stripe account's default API version which may be different than Stripe.net's API version.

member.name: T:Stripe.Infrastructure.StripeObjectConverter
member.summary: This converter can be used to deserialize any Stripe object. It is mainly useful for polymorphic attributes, when the property's type is an interface instead of a concrete type. In this case, the converter will use the value of the `object` key in the JSON payload to decide which concrete type to instantiate. If no concrete type is found (or if one is found, but it's not compatible with the expected interface), then the converter returns `null`.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeConfiguration.SerializerSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the settings used for deserializing JSON objects returned by Stripe's API. It is highly recommended you do not change these settings, as doing so can produce unexpected results. If you do change these settings, make sure that is among the converters, otherwise Stripe.net will no longer be able to deserialize polymorphic resources represented by interfaces (e.g. ).

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeConfiguration.MaxNetworkRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times that the library will retry requests that appear to have failed due to an intermittent problem.

member.summary: Gets or sets the flag enabling request latency telemetry. Enabled by default.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeRequest.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method for the request (GET, POST or DELETE).

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeRequest.Uri
member.summary: The URL for the request. If this is a GET or DELETE request, the URL also includes the request parameters in its query string.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeRequest.AuthorizationHeader
member.summary: The value of the Authorization header with the API key.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeRequest.StripeHeaders
member.summary: Dictionary containing Stripe custom headers (Stripe-Version, Stripe-Account, Idempotency-Key...).

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeRequest.Content
member.summary: The body of the request. For POST requests, this will be either a application/x-www-form-urlencoded or a multipart/form-data payload. For non-POST requests, this will be null.
member.remarks: This getter creates a new instance every time it is called.

member.name: F:Stripe.StripeTypeRegistry.ObjectsToTypes
member.summary: Dictionary mapping the values contained in the `object` key of JSON payloads returned by Stripe's API to concrete types of model classes.

member.name: M:Stripe.StripeTypeRegistry.GetConcreteType(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the concrete type to use, given a potential type and the value of the `object` key in a JSON payload.
member.param: Potential type. Can be a concrete type or an interface.
Value of the `object` key in the JSON payload.
member.returns: The concrete type to use, or `null`.

member.name: T:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient
member.summary: Standard client to make requests to Stripe's API, using to send HTTP requests. It can gather telemetry about request latency (via ) and automatically retry failed requests when it's safe to do so.

member.name: F:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.DefaultMaxNumberRetries
member.summary: Default maximum number of retries made by the client.

member.name: M:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.Int32,Stripe.AppInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The client to use. If null, an HTTP client will be created with default parameters.
The maximum number of times the client will retry requests that fail due to an intermittent problem.
Information about the "app" which this integration belongs to. This should be reserved for plugins that wish to identify themselves with Stripe.
Whether to enable request latency telemetry or not.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.DefaultHttpTimeout
member.summary: Default timespan before the request times out.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.MaxNetworkRetriesDelay
member.summary: Maximum sleep time between tries to send HTTP requests after network failure.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.MinNetworkRetriesDelay
member.summary: Minimum sleep time between tries to send HTTP requests after network failure.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.EnableTelemetry
member.summary: Gets whether telemetry was enabled for this client.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.MaxNetworkRetries
member.summary: Gets how many network retries were configured for this client.

member.name: P:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.NetworkRetriesSleep
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the client should sleep between automatic request retries.
member.remarks: This is an internal property meant to be used in tests only.

member.name: M:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.BuildDefaultSystemNetHttpClient
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default parameters.
member.returns: The new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Stripe.SystemNetHttpClient.MakeRequestAsync(Stripe.StripeRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends a request to Stripe's API as an asynchronous operation.
member.param: The parameters of the request to send.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.Account
member.summary: The identifier of the account to create an account link for.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.Collect
member.summary: Which information the platform needs to collect from the user. One of currently_due or eventually_due. Default is currently_due. One of: currently_due, or eventually_due.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.RefreshUrl
member.summary: The URL that the user will be redirected to if the account link is no longer valid. Your refresh_url should trigger a method on your server to create a new account link using this API, with the same parameters, and redirect the user to the new account link.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL that the user will be redirected to upon leaving or completing the linked flow.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountLinkCreateOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of account link the user is requesting. Possible values are account_onboarding or account_update. One of: account_onboarding, account_update, custom_account_update, or custom_account_verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.AccountHolderName
member.summary: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.This field is required when attaching the bank account to a Customer object.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.AccountHolderType
member.summary: The type of entity that holds the account. It can be company or individual. This field is required when attaching the bank account to a Customer object.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.AccountNumber
member.summary: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a checking account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.Country
member.summary: The country in which the bank account is located.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.Currency
member.summary: The currency the bank account is in. This must be a country/currency pairing that Stripe supports..

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBankAccountOptions.RoutingNumber
member.summary: The routing number, sort code, or other country-appropriateinstitution number for the bank account. For US bank accounts, this is required and should bethe ACH routing number, not the wire routing number. If you are providing an IBAN foraccount_number, this field is not required.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.Mcc
member.summary: The merchant category code for the account. MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.Name
member.summary: The customer-facing business name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.ProductDescription
member.summary: Internal-only description of the product sold by, or service provided by, the business. Used by Stripe for risk and underwriting purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.SupportAddress
member.summary: A publicly available mailing address for sending support issues to.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.SupportEmail
member.summary: A publicly available email address for sending support issues to.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.SupportPhone
member.summary: A publicly available phone number to call with support issues.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.SupportUrl
member.summary: A publicly available website for handling support issues.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountBusinessProfileOptions.Url
member.summary: The business's publicly available website.
