member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCardOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Address
member.summary: The company's primary address.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.AddressKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.AddressKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.DirectorsProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's directors have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's directors with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.director requirement. This value is not automatically set to true after creating directors, so it needs to be updated to indicate all directors have been provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.ExecutivesProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's executives have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's executives with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.executive requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Name
member.summary: The company's legal name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.NameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.NameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the company's legal name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.OwnersProvided
member.summary: Whether the company's owners have been provided. Set this Boolean to true after creating all the company's owners with the Persons API for accounts with a relationship.owner requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Phone
member.summary: The company's phone number (used for verification).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.RegistrationNumber
member.summary: The identification number given to a company when it is registered or incorporated, if distinct from the identification number used for filing taxes. (Examples are the CIN for companies and LLP IN for partnerships in India, and the Company Registration Number in Hong Kong).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Structure
member.summary: The category identifying the legal structure of the company or legal entity. See Business structure for more details.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.TaxId
member.summary: The business ID number of the company, as appropriate for the company’s country. (Examples are an Employer ID Number in the U.S., a Business Number in Canada, or a Company Number in the UK.).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.TaxIdRegistrar
member.summary: The jurisdiction in which the tax_id is registered (Germany-based companies only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.VatId
member.summary: The VAT number of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyOptions.Verification
member.summary: Information on the verification state of the company.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of a document returned by a file upload with a purpose value of additional_verification. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCompanyVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: A document verifying the business.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.AccountToken
member.summary: An account token, used to securely provide details to the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.BusinessProfile
member.summary: Business information about the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.BusinessType
member.summary: The business type. One of: company, government_entity, individual, or non_profit.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Capabilities
member.summary: Each key of the dictionary represents a capability, and each capability maps to its settings (e.g. whether it has been requested or not). Each capability will be inactive until you have provided its specific requirements and Stripe has verified them. An account may have some of its requested capabilities be active and some be inactive.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Company
member.summary: Information about the company or business. This field is available for any business_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Country
member.summary: The country in which the account holder resides, or in which the business is legally established. This should be an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. For example, if you are in the United States and the business for which you're creating an account is legally represented in Canada, you would use CA as the country for the account being created.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.DefaultCurrency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the default currency for the account. This must be a currency that Stripe supports in the account's country.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Documents
member.summary: Documents that may be submitted to satisfy various informational requests.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the account holder. This is only to make the account easier to identify to you. Stripe will never directly email Custom accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Individual
member.summary: Information about the person represented by the account. This field is null unless business_type is set to individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Settings
member.summary: Options for customizing how the account functions within Stripe.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.TosAcceptance
member.summary: Details on the account's acceptance of the Stripe Services Agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountCreateOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of Stripe account to create. May be one of custom, express or standard. One of: custom, express, or standard.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsBankAccountOwnershipVerificationOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsCompanyLicenseOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsCompanyMemorandumOfAssociationOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsCompanyMinisterialDecreeOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsCompanyRegistrationVerificationOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsCompanyTaxIdVerificationOptions.Files
member.summary: One or more document ids returned by a file upload with a purpose value of account_requirement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.BankAccountOwnershipVerification
member.summary: One or more documents that support the Bank account ownership verification requirement. Must be a document associated with the account’s primary active bank account that displays the last 4 digits of the account number, either a statement or a voided check.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyLicense
member.summary: One or more documents that demonstrate proof of a company's license to operate.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyMemorandumOfAssociation
member.summary: One or more documents showing the company's Memorandum of Association.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyMinisterialDecree
member.summary: (Certain countries only) One or more documents showing the ministerial decree legalizing the company's establishment.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyRegistrationVerification
member.summary: One or more documents that demonstrate proof of a company's registration with the appropriate local authorities.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountDocumentsOptions.CompanyTaxIdVerification
member.summary: One or more documents that demonstrate proof of a company's tax ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.Address
member.summary: The individual's primary address.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.AddressKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the the individual's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.AddressKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the the individual's primary address (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.Dob
member.summary: The individual's date of birth.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.Email
member.summary: The individual's email address.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.FirstName
member.summary: The individual's first name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.FirstNameKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the the individual's first name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.FirstNameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the individual's first name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.Gender
member.summary: The individual's gender (International regulations require either "male" or "female").

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.IdNumber
member.summary: The government-issued ID number of the individual, as appropriate for the representative’s country. (Examples are a Social Security Number in the U.S., or a Social Insurance Number in Canada). Instead of the number itself, you can also provide a PII token created with Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.LastName
member.summary: The individual's last name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.LastNameKana
member.summary: The Kana varation of the individual's last name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.LastNameKanji
member.summary: The Kanji varation of the individual's last name (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.MaidenName
member.summary: The individual's maiden name.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.Phone
member.summary: The individual's phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.PoliticalExposure
member.summary: Indicates if the person or any of their representatives, family members, or other closely related persons, declares that they hold or have held an important public job or function, in any jurisdiction. One of: existing, or none.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.SsnLast4
member.summary: The last four digits of the individual's Social Security Number (U.S. only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualOptions.Verification
member.summary: The individual's verification document information.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationOptions.AdditionalDocument
member.summary: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountIndividualVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: An identifying document, either a passport or local ID card.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountRejectOptions.Reason
member.summary: The reason for rejecting the account. Can be fraud, terms_of_service, or other.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBrandingOptions.Icon
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) An icon for the account. Must be square and at least 128px x 128px.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBrandingOptions.Logo
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) A logo for the account that will be used in Checkout instead of the icon and without the account's name next to it if provided. Must be at least 128px x 128px.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBrandingOptions.PrimaryColor
member.summary: A CSS hex color value representing the primary branding color for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsBrandingOptions.SecondaryColor
member.summary: A CSS hex color value representing the secondary branding color for this account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsDeclineOnOptions.AvsFailure
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect ZIP or postal code. This setting only applies when a ZIP or postal code is provided and they fail bank verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsDeclineOnOptions.CvcFailure
member.summary: Whether Stripe automatically declines charges with an incorrect CVC. This setting only applies when a CVC is provided and it fails bank verification.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsOptions.DeclineOn
member.summary: Automatically declines certain charge types regardless of whether the card issuer accepted or declined the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsCardPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptorPrefix
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge. statement_descriptor_prefix is useful for maximizing descriptor space for the dynamic portion.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.Branding
member.summary: Settings used to apply the account's branding to email receipts, invoices, Checkout, and other products.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.CardPayments
member.summary: Settings specific to card charging on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.Payments
member.summary: Settings that apply across payment methods for charging on the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsOptions.Payouts
member.summary: Settings specific to the account's payouts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made. This field prefixes any dynamic statement_descriptor specified on the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptorKana
member.summary: The Kana variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPaymentsOptions.StatementDescriptorKanji
member.summary: The Kanji variation of the default text that appears on credit card statements when a charge is made (Japan only).

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsOptions.DebitNegativeBalances
member.summary: A Boolean indicating whether Stripe should try to reclaim negative balances from an attached bank account. For details, see Understanding Connect Account Balances.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsOptions.Schedule
member.summary: Details on when funds from charges are available, and when they are paid out to an external account. For details, see our Setting Bank and Debit Card Payouts documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: The text that appears on the bank account statement for payouts. If not set, this defaults to the platform's bank descriptor as set in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsScheduleOptions.DelayDays
member.summary: temp.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsScheduleOptions.Interval
member.summary: How frequently available funds are paid out. One of: daily, manual, weekly, or monthly. Default is daily. One of: daily, manual, monthly, or weekly.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsScheduleOptions.MonthlyAnchor
member.summary: The day of the month when available funds are paid out, specified as a number between 1--31. Payouts nominally scheduled between the 29th and 31st of the month are instead sent on the last day of a shorter month. Required and applicable only if interval is monthly.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountSettingsPayoutsScheduleOptions.WeeklyAnchor
member.summary: The day of the week when available funds are paid out, specified as monday, tuesday, etc. (required and applicable only if interval is weekly.). One of: friday, monday, saturday, sunday, thursday, tuesday, or wednesday.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountTosAcceptanceOptions.Date
member.summary: The Unix timestamp marking when the account representative accepted their service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountTosAcceptanceOptions.Ip
member.summary: The IP address from which the account representative accepted their service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountTosAcceptanceOptions.ServiceAgreement
member.summary: The user's service agreement type.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountTosAcceptanceOptions.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent of the browser from which the account representative accepted their service agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.AccountToken
member.summary: An account token, used to securely provide details to the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.BusinessProfile
member.summary: Business information about the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.BusinessType
member.summary: The business type. One of: company, government_entity, individual, or non_profit.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Capabilities
member.summary: Each key of the dictionary represents a capability, and each capability maps to its settings (e.g. whether it has been requested or not). Each capability will be inactive until you have provided its specific requirements and Stripe has verified them. An account may have some of its requested capabilities be active and some be inactive.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Company
member.summary: Information about the company or business. This field is available for any business_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.DefaultCurrency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the default currency for the account. This must be a currency that Stripe supports in the account's country.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Documents
member.summary: Documents that may be submitted to satisfy various informational requests.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the account holder. This is only to make the account easier to identify to you. Stripe will never directly email Custom accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Individual
member.summary: Information about the person represented by the account. This field is null unless business_type is set to individual.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.Settings
member.summary: Options for customizing how the account functions within Stripe.

member.name: P:Stripe.AccountUpdateOptions.TosAcceptance
member.summary: Details on the account's acceptance of the Stripe Services Agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.ApplicationFeeRefundCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer, in %s, representing how much of this fee to refund. Can refund only up to the remaining unrefunded amount of the fee.

member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountUpdateOptions.AccountHolderName
member.summary: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountUpdateOptions.AccountHolderType
member.summary: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either individual or company.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.BankAccountVerifyOptions.Amounts
member.summary: Two positive integers, in cents, equal to the values of the microdeposits sent to the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.CapabilityUpdateOptions.Requested
member.summary: Passing true requests the capability for the account, if it is not already requested. A requested capability may not immediately become active. Any requirements to activate the capability are returned in the requirements arrays.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressCity
member.summary: City/District/Suburb/Town/Village.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressCountry
member.summary: Billing address country, if provided when creating card.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressLine1
member.summary: Address line 1 (Street address/PO Box/Company name).

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressLine2
member.summary: Address line 2 (Apartment/Suite/Unit/Building).

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.AddressState
member.summary: State/County/Province/Region.

member.summary: ZIP or postal code.

member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.CardUpdateOptions.Name
member.summary: Cardholder name.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount to capture, which must be less than or equal to the original amount. Any additional amount will be automatically refunded.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ApplicationFee
member.summary: An application fee to add on to this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: An application fee amount to add on to this charge, which must be less than or equal to the original amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: The email address to send this charge's receipt to. This will override the previously-specified email address for this charge, if one was set. Receipts will not be sent in test mode.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For card charges, use statement_descriptor_suffix instead. Otherwise, you can use this value as the complete description of a charge on your customers’ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.TransferData
member.summary: An optional dictionary including the account to automatically transfer to as part of a destination charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCaptureOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. transfer_group may only be provided if it has not been set. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in %s that will be applied to the charge and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key or the Stripe-Account header in order to take an application fee. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Capture
member.summary: Whether to immediately capture the charge. Defaults to true. When false, the charge issues an authorization (or pre-authorization), and will need to be captured later. Uncaptured charges expire in seven days. For more information, see the authorizing charges and settling later documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a Charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID for which these funds are intended. Automatically set if you use the destination parameter. For details, see Creating Separate Charges and Transfers.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: The email address to which this charge's receipt will be sent. The receipt will not be sent until the charge is paid, and no receipts will be sent for test mode charges. If this charge is for a Customer, the email address specified here will override the customer's email address. If receipt_email is specified for a charge in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For card charges, use statement_descriptor_suffix instead. Otherwise, you can use this value as the complete description of a charge on your customers’ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about the charge that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: An optional dictionary including the account to automatically transfer to as part of a destination charge. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeCreateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. For details, see Grouping transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeDestinationOptions.Account
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeDestinationOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount to transfer to the destination account without creating an Application Fee object. Cannot be combined with the application_fee parameter. Must be less than or equal to the charge amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeFraudDetailsOptions.UserReport
member.summary: Either safe or fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.Address
member.summary: Shipping address.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.Carrier
member.summary: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.Name
member.summary: Recipient name.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.Phone
member.summary: Recipient phone (including extension).

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeShippingOptions.TrackingNumber
member.summary: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount transferred to the destination account, if specified. By default, the entire charge amount is transferred to the destination account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be associated with this request. This field may only be updated if there is no existing associated customer with this charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.FraudDetails
member.summary: A set of key-value pairs you can attach to a charge giving information about its riskiness. If you believe a charge is fraudulent, include a user_report key with a value of fraudulent. If you believe a charge is safe, include a user_report key with a value of safe. Stripe will use the information you send to improve our fraud detection algorithms.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: This is the email address that the receipt for this charge will be sent to. If this field is updated, then a new email receipt will be sent to the updated address.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods.

member.name: P:Stripe.ChargeUpdateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. transfer_group may only be provided if it has not been set. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponAppliesToOptions.Products
member.summary: An array of Product IDs that this Coupon will apply to.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.AmountOff
member.summary: A positive integer representing the amount to subtract from an invoice total (required if percent_off is not passed).

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.AppliesTo
member.summary: A hash containing directions for what this Coupon will apply discounts to.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO code for the currency of the amount_off parameter (required if amount_off is passed).

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Duration
member.summary: Specifies how long the discount will be in effect. Can be forever, once, or repeating. One of: forever, once, or repeating.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.DurationInMonths
member.summary: Required only if duration is repeating, in which case it must be a positive integer that specifies the number of months the discount will be in effect.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: Unique string of your choice that will be used to identify this coupon when applying it to a customer. If you don't want to specify a particular code, you can leave the ID blank and we'll generate a random code for you.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.MaxRedemptions
member.summary: A positive integer specifying the number of times the coupon can be redeemed before it's no longer valid. For example, you might have a 50% off coupon that the first 20 readers of your blog can use.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.Name
member.summary: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on, for instance invoices, or receipts. By default the id is shown if name is not set.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.PercentOff
member.summary: A positive float larger than 0, and smaller or equal to 100, that represents the discount the coupon will apply (required if amount_off is not passed).

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponCreateOptions.RedeemBy
member.summary: Unix timestamp specifying the last time at which the coupon can be redeemed. After the redeem_by date, the coupon can no longer be applied to new customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.CouponUpdateOptions.Name
member.summary: Name of the coupon displayed to customers on, for instance invoices, or receipts. By default the id is shown if name is not set.

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteCreateOptions.Reason

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.Type

member.name: P:Stripe.CreditNoteLineOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The integer unit amount in %s of the credit note line item. This unit_amount will be multiplied by the quantity to get the full amount to credit for this line item. Only valid when type is custom_line_item.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.Balance

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object. It is displayed alongside the customer in the dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerCreateOptions.Email

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerInvoiceSettingsOptions.CustomFields

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerInvoiceSettingsOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of a payment method that's attached to the customer, to be used as the customer's default payment method for subscriptions and invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerInvoiceSettingsOptions.Footer

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerTaxIdDataOptions.Type

One of: ae_trn, au_abn, br_cnpj, br_cpf, ca_bn, ca_qst, ch_vat, cl_tin, es_cif, eu_vat, gb_vat, hk_br, id_npwp, in_gst, jp_cn, jp_rn, kr_brn, li_uid, mx_rfc, my_frp, my_itn, my_sst, no_vat, nz_gst, ru_inn, ru_kpp, sa_vat, sg_gst, sg_uen, th_vat, tw_vat, us_ein, or za_vat.

member.summary: Value of the tax ID.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.Address
member.summary: The customer's address.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.Balance
member.summary: An integer amount in %s that represents the customer's current balance, which affect the customer's future invoices. A negative amount represents a credit that decreases the amount due on an invoice; a positive amount increases the amount due on an invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.DefaultSource
member.summary:
If you are using payment methods created via the PaymentMethods API, see the invoice_settings.default_payment_method parameter.
Provide the ID of a payment source already attached to this customer to make it this customer's default payment source.
If you want to add a new payment source and make it the default, see the source property.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object. It is displayed alongside the customer in the dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.Email
member.summary: Customer's email address. It's displayed alongside the customer in your dashboard and can be useful for searching and tracking. This may be up to 512 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.InvoicePrefix
member.summary: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers. Must be 3–12 uppercase letters or numbers.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.InvoiceSettings
member.summary: Default invoice settings for this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.Name
member.summary: The customer's full name or business name.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.NextInvoiceSequence
member.summary: The sequence to be used on the customer's next invoice. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.Phone
member.summary: The customer's phone number.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.PreferredLocales
member.summary: Customer's preferred languages, ordered by preference.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.PromotionCode
member.summary: The API ID of a promotion code to apply to the customer. The customer will have a discount applied on all recurring payments. Charges you create through the API will not have the discount.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: The customer's shipping information. Appears on invoices emailed to this customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.CustomerUpdateOptions.TaxExempt
member.summary: The customer's tax exemption. One of none, exempt, or reverse.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.AccessActivityLog
member.summary: Any server or activity logs showing proof that the customer accessed or downloaded the purchased digital product. This information should include IP addresses, corresponding timestamps, and any detailed recorded activity. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.BillingAddress
member.summary: The billing address provided by the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CancellationPolicy
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Your subscription cancellation policy, as shown to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CancellationPolicyDisclosure
member.summary: An explanation of how and when the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CancellationRebuttal
member.summary: A justification for why the customer's subscription was not canceled. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerCommunication
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Any communication with the customer that you feel is relevant to your case. Examples include emails proving that the customer received the product or service, or demonstrating their use of or satisfaction with the product or service.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerEmailAddress
member.summary: The email address of the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerName
member.summary: The name of the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerPurchaseIp
member.summary: The IP address that the customer used when making the purchase.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.CustomerSignature
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) A relevant document or contract showing the customer's signature.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.DuplicateChargeDocumentation
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Documentation for the prior charge that can uniquely identify the charge, such as a receipt, shipping label, work order, etc. This document should be paired with a similar document from the disputed payment that proves the two payments are separate.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.DuplicateChargeExplanation
member.summary: An explanation of the difference between the disputed charge versus the prior charge that appears to be a duplicate. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.DuplicateChargeId
member.summary: The Stripe ID for the prior charge which appears to be a duplicate of the disputed charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ProductDescription
member.summary: A description of the product or service that was sold. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.Receipt
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Any receipt or message sent to the customer notifying them of the charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.RefundPolicy
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Your refund policy, as shown to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.RefundPolicyDisclosure
member.summary: Documentation demonstrating that the customer was shown your refund policy prior to purchase. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.RefundRefusalExplanation
member.summary: A justification for why the customer is not entitled to a refund. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ServiceDate
member.summary: The date on which the customer received or began receiving the purchased service, in a clear human-readable format.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ServiceDocumentation
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Documentation showing proof that a service was provided to the customer. This could include a copy of a signed contract, work order, or other form of written agreement.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingAddress
member.summary: The address to which a physical product was shipped. You should try to include as complete address information as possible.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingCarrier
member.summary: The delivery service that shipped a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc. If multiple carriers were used for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingDate
member.summary: The date on which a physical product began its route to the shipping address, in a clear human-readable format.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingDocumentation
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Documentation showing proof that a product was shipped to the customer at the same address the customer provided to you. This could include a copy of the shipment receipt, shipping label, etc. It should show the customer's full shipping address, if possible.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.ShippingTrackingNumber
member.summary: The tracking number for a physical product, obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.UncategorizedFile
member.summary: (ID of a file upload) Any additional evidence or statements.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeEvidenceOptions.UncategorizedText
member.summary: Any additional evidence or statements. Has a maximum character count of 20,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Evidence
member.summary: Evidence to upload, to respond to a dispute. Updating any field in the hash will submit all fields in the hash for review. The combined character count of all fields is limited to 150,000.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.DisputeUpdateOptions.Submit
member.summary: Whether to immediately submit evidence to the bank. If false, evidence is staged on the dispute. Staged evidence is visible in the API and Dashboard, and can be submitted to the bank by making another request with this attribute set to true (the default).

member.name: P:Stripe.EphemeralKeyCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the Customer you'd like to modify using the resulting ephemeral key.

member.name: P:Stripe.EphemeralKeyCreateOptions.IssuingCard
member.summary: The ID of the Issuing Card you'd like to access using the resulting ephemeral key.

member.name: T:Stripe.EventUtility
member.summary: This class contains utility methods to process event objects in Stripe's webhooks.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ParseEvent(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.
member.remarks: This method doesn't verify webhook signatures. It's recommended that you use instead.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ConstructEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object, while verifying the webhook's signature.
member.param: The value of the Stripe-Signature header from the webhook request.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the signature verification fails for any reason, of if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.

member.name: M:Stripe.EventUtility.ConstructEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a JSON string from a Stripe webhook into a object, while verifying the webhook's signature.
member.param: The value of the Stripe-Signature header from the webhook request.
The timestamp to use for the current time.
member.returns: The deserialized .
member.exception: Thrown if the signature verification fails for any reason, of if the API version of the event doesn't match Stripe.net's default API version.

member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.FileFileLinkDataOptions.Create
member.summary: Set this to true to create a file link for the newly created file. Creating a link is only possible when the file's purpose is one of the following: business_icon, business_logo, customer_signature, dispute_evidence, pci_document, or tax_document_user_upload.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: The integer amount in %s of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. Passing in a negative amount will reduce the amount_due on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the customer who will be billed when this invoice item is billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to the invoice item. The description is displayed in the invoice for easy tracking.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Discountable
member.summary: Controls whether discounts apply to this invoice item. Defaults to false for prorations or negative invoice items, and true for all other invoice items.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The coupons to redeem into discounts for the invoice item or invoice line item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Invoice
member.summary: The ID of an existing invoice to add this invoice item to. When left blank, the invoice item will be added to the next upcoming scheduled invoice. This is useful when adding invoice items in response to an invoice.created webhook. You can only add invoice items to draft invoices and there is a maximum of 250 items per invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Period
member.summary: The period associated with this invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Non-negative integer. The quantity of units for the invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.Subscription
member.summary: The ID of a subscription to add this invoice item to. When left blank, the invoice item will be be added to the next upcoming scheduled invoice. When set, scheduled invoices for subscriptions other than the specified subscription will ignore the invoice item. Use this when you want to express that an invoice item has been accrued within the context of a particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to the invoice item. When set, the default_tax_rates on the invoice do not apply to this invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The integer unit amount in %s of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. This unit_amount will be multiplied by the quantity to get the full amount. Passing in a negative unit_amount will reduce the amount_due on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemCreateOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in %s with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemDiscountOptions.Coupon
member.summary: ID of the coupon to create a new discount for.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemDiscountOptions.Discount
member.summary: ID of an existing discount on the object (or one of its ancestors) to reuse.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Amount
member.summary: The integer amount in %s of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. If you want to apply a credit to the customer's account, pass a negative amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to the invoice item. The description is displayed in the invoice for easy tracking.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Discountable
member.summary: Controls whether discounts apply to this invoice item. Defaults to false for prorations or negative invoice items, and true for all other invoice items. Cannot be set to true for prorations.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The coupons & existing discounts which apply to the invoice item or invoice line item. Item discounts are applied before invoice discounts. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined discounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Period
member.summary: The period associated with this invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Non-negative integer. The quantity of units for the invoice item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates which apply to the invoice item. When set, the default_tax_rates on the invoice do not apply to this invoice item. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The integer unit amount in %s of the charge to be applied to the upcoming invoice. This unit_amount will be multiplied by the quantity to get the full amount. If you want to apply a credit to the customer's account, pass a negative unit_amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceItemUpdateOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in %s with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.AccountTaxIds
member.summary: The account tax IDs associated with the invoice. Only editable when the invoice is a draft.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in %s that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key or the Stripe-Account header in order to take an application fee. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will perform automatic collection of the invoice. When false, the invoice's state will not automatically advance without an explicit action.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically, or send_invoice. When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this invoice using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email this invoice to the customer with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.CustomFields
member.summary: A list of up to 4 custom fields to be displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of the customer who will be billed.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: The number of days from when the invoice is created until it is due. Valid only for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DefaultSource
member.summary: ID of the default payment source for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default source, if any, or to the customer's default source.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any line item that does not have tax_rates set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. Referenced as 'memo' in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The coupons to redeem into discounts for the invoice. If not specified, inherits the discount from the invoice's customer. Pass an empty string to avoid inheriting any discounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.DueDate
member.summary: The date on which payment for this invoice is due. Valid only for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Footer
member.summary: Footer to be displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.PaymentSettings
member.summary: Configuration settings for the PaymentIntent that is generated when the invoice is finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a charge for the customer's credit card statement. It must contain at least one letter. If not specified and this invoice is part of a subscription, the default statement_descriptor will be set to the first subscription item's product's statement_descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.Subscription
member.summary: The ID of the subscription to invoice, if any. If not set, the created invoice will include all pending invoice items for the customer. If set, the created invoice will only include pending invoice items for that subscription and pending invoice items not associated with any subscription. The subscription's billing cycle and regular subscription events won't be affected.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCreateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: If specified, the funds from the invoice will be transferred to the destination and the ID of the resulting transfer will be found on the invoice's charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomFieldOptions.Name
member.summary: The name of the custom field. This may be up to 30 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceCustomFieldOptions.Value
member.summary: The value of the custom field. This may be up to 30 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceDiscountOptions.Coupon
member.summary: ID of the coupon to create a new discount for.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceDiscountOptions.Discount
member.summary: ID of an existing discount on the object (or one of its ancestors) to reuse.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceFinalizeOptions.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will perform automatic collection of the invoice. When false, the invoice's state will not automatically advance without an explicit action.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration to provide to the invoice’s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) to provide to the invoice’s PaymentIntent. If not set, Stripe attempts to automatically determine the types to use by looking at the invoice’s default payment method, the subscription’s default payment method, the customer’s default payment method, and your invoice template settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsBancontactOptions.PreferredLanguage
member.summary: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to. One of: de, en, fr, or nl.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, or automatic.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Bancontact
member.summary: If paying by bancontact, this sub-hash contains details about the Bancontact payment method options to pass to the invoice’s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePaymentSettingsPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.Card
member.summary: If paying by card, this sub-hash contains details about the Card payment method options to pass to the invoice’s PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.Forgive
member.summary:
In cases where the source used to pay the invoice has insufficient funds, passing forgive=true controls whether a charge should be attempted for the full amount available on the source, up to the amount to fully pay the invoice. This effectively forgives the difference between the amount available on the source and the amount due.
Passing forgive=false will fail the charge if the source hasn't been pre-funded with the right amount. An example for this case is with ACH Credit Transfers and wires: if the amount wired is less than the amount due by a small amount, you might want to forgive the difference. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.OffSession
member.summary: Indicates if a customer is on or off-session while an invoice payment is attempted. Defaults to true (off-session).

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.PaidOutOfBand
member.summary: Boolean representing whether an invoice is paid outside of Stripe. This will result in no charge being made. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: A PaymentMethod to be charged. The PaymentMethod must be the ID of a PaymentMethod belonging to the customer associated with the invoice being paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoicePayOptions.Source
member.summary: A payment source to be charged. The source must be the ID of a source belonging to the customer associated with the invoice being paid.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemBillingThresholdsOptions.UsageGte
member.summary: Usage threshold that triggers the subscription to advance to a new billing period.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.BillingThresholds
member.summary: Define thresholds at which an invoice will be sent, and the subscription advanced to a new billing period. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined thresholds.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.ClearUsage
member.summary: Delete all usage for a given subscription item. Allowed only when deleted is set to true and the current plan's usage_type is metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Deleted
member.summary: A flag that, if set to true, will delete the specified item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Id
member.summary: Subscription item to update.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Plan
member.summary: Plan ID for this item, as a string.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Price
member.summary: The ID of the price object.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.PriceData
member.summary: Data used to generate a new Price object inline.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.Quantity
member.summary: Quantity for this item.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemOptions.TaxRates
member.summary: A list of Tax Rate ids. These Tax Rates will override the default_tax_rates on the Subscription. When updating, pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as interval and usage_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A positive integer in %s (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in %s with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceSubscriptionItemPriceDataRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary: The amount that will be transferred automatically when the invoice is paid. If no amount is set, the full amount is transferred.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.AccountTaxIds
member.summary: The account tax IDs associated with the invoice. Only editable when the invoice is a draft.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: A fee in %s that will be applied to the invoice and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key or the Stripe-Account header in order to take an application fee. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Controls whether Stripe will perform automatic collection of the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Either charge_automatically or send_invoice. This field can be updated only on draft invoices. One of: charge_automatically, or send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.CustomFields
member.summary: A list of up to 4 custom fields to be displayed on the invoice. If a value for custom_fields is specified, the list specified will replace the existing custom field list on this invoice. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined fields.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: The number of days from which the invoice is created until it is due. Only valid for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice. This field can only be updated on draft invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DefaultPaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the default payment method for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default payment method, if any, or to the default payment method in the customer's invoice settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DefaultSource
member.summary: ID of the default payment source for the invoice. It must belong to the customer associated with the invoice and be in a chargeable state. If not set, defaults to the subscription's default source, if any, or to the customer's default source.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DefaultTaxRates
member.summary: The tax rates that will apply to any line item that does not have tax_rates set. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined tax rates.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users. Referenced as 'memo' in the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Discounts
member.summary: The discounts that will apply to the invoice. Pass an empty string to remove previously-defined discounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.DueDate
member.summary: The date on which payment for this invoice is due. Only valid for invoices where collection_method=send_invoice. This field can only be updated on draft invoices.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Footer
member.summary: Footer to be displayed on the invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.PaymentSettings
member.summary: Configuration settings for the PaymentIntent that is generated when the invoice is finalized.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a charge for the customer's credit card statement. It must contain at least one letter. If not specified and this invoice is part of a subscription, the default statement_descriptor will be set to the first subscription item's product's statement_descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.InvoiceUpdateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: If specified, the funds from the invoice will be transferred to the destination and the ID of the resulting transfer will be found on the invoice's charge. This will be unset if you POST an empty value.

member.name: P:Stripe.LoginLinkCreateOptions.RedirectUrl
member.summary: Where to redirect the user after they log out of their dashboard.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.AlwaysPrompt
member.summary: Boolean to indicate that the user should always be asked to connect, even if they're already connected. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.ClientId
member.summary: The unique identifier provided to your application, found in your application settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.ResponseType
member.summary: The only option at the moment is code.

summary.para: The URL for the authorize response redirect. If provided, this must exactly match one of the comma-separated redirect_uri values in your application settings.
To protect yourself from certain forms of man-in-the-middle attacks, the live mode redirect_uri must use a secure HTTPS connection.
Defaults to the redirect_uri in your application settings if not provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.Scope
member.summary: read_write or read_only, depending on the level of access you need. Defaults to read_only.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.State
member.summary: An arbitrary string value we will pass back to you, useful for CSRF protection.

summary.para: login or register, depending on what type of screen you want your users to see. Only override this to be login if you expect all your users to have Stripe accounts already (e.g., most read-only applications, like analytics dashboards or accounting software).
Defaults to login for scope read_only and register for scope read_write.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.StripeUser

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlOptions.SuggestedCapabilities
member.summary: If your platform is designated for one Capability (either card_payments or transfers), you won't need to specify additional Capabilities. However, if your platform supports both, you can add a Capability to an individual Express account by including the parameter in your OAuth link.

summary.para: The Kana variation of the address block.

Address city of the business.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthAuthorizeUrlStripeUserOptions.StreetAddress

summary.para: The URL for the user's business. This may be the user's website, a profile page within your application, or another publicly available profile for the business, such as a LinkedIn or Facebook profile.
Must be URL-encoded and include a scheme (http or https).

If you will be prefilling this field, we highly recommend that the linked page contain a description of the user's products or services and their contact information. If we don't have enough information, we'll have to reach out to the user directly before initiating payouts.
Address postal code of the business.
We highly recommend that you also prefill with the corresponding country.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthDeauthorizeOptions.ClientId

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthDeauthorizeOptions.StripeUserId

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.AssertCapabilities
member.summary: If you specified a Capability using the parameter, you can verify that Stripe applied the suggested Capability in this POST request by including and identifying that card_payments or transfers match. A request error will be returned if the suggested Capability doesn't match the assertion: in this case, it's recommended to end the onboarding flow with a failure.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.ClientSecret
member.summary: The secret API key. When converting an authorization code to an access token, you must use an API key that matches the mode—live or test—of the authorization code (which depends on whether the client_id used was production or development).

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.Code
member.summary: The value of the code, depending on the grant_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.GrantType
member.summary: authorization_code when turning an authorization code into an access token, or refresh_token when using a refresh token to get a new access token.

member.name: P:Stripe.OAuthTokenCreateOptions.RefreshToken
member.summary: The value of the refresh_token, depending on the grant_type.

summary.para: When requesting a new access token from a refresh token, any scope that has an equal or lesser scope as the refresh token. Has no effect when requesting an access token from an authorization code.
Defaults to the scope of the refresh token.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: A coupon code that represents a discount to be applied to this order. Must be one-time duration and in same currency as the order. An order can have multiple coupons.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer to use for this order. If provided, the customer email and shipping address will be used to create the order. Subsequently, the customer will also be charged to pay the order. If email or shipping are also provided, they will override the values retrieved from the customer object.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the customer placing the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Items
member.summary: List of items constituting the order. An order can have up to 25 items.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping address for the order. Required if any of the SKUs are for products that have shippable set to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderItemOptions.Parent

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Customer
