member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the customer placing the order. Required if not previously specified for the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderPayOptions.Source
member.summary: A Token's or a Source's ID, as returned by Elements. If no customer was attached to the order at creation, either source or customer is required. Otherwise, the specified source will be charged intead of the customer attached to the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderReturnOptions.Items
member.summary: List of items to return.

member.summary: Date this order was fulfilled.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Coupon

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.SelectedShippingMethod
member.summary: The shipping method to select for fulfilling this order. If specified, must be one of the ids of a shipping method in the shipping_methods array. If specified, will overwrite the existing selected shipping method, updating items as necessary.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Tracking information once the order has been fulfilled.

member.name: P:Stripe.OrderUpdateOptions.Status
member.summary: Current order status. One of created, paid, canceled, fulfilled, or returned. More detail in the Orders Guide. One of: canceled, created, fulfilled, paid, or returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCancelOptions.CancellationReason
member.summary: Reason for canceling this PaymentIntent. Possible values are duplicate, fraudulent, requested_by_customer, or abandoned. One of: abandoned, duplicate, fraudulent, or requested_by_customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.AmountToCapture
member.summary: The amount to capture from the PaymentIntent, which must be less than or equal to the original amount. Any additional amount will be automatically refunded. Defaults to the full amount_capturable if not provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For non-card charges, you can use this value as the complete description that appears on your customers’ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCaptureOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment is captured. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ErrorOnRequiresAction
member.summary: Set to true to fail the payment attempt if the PaymentIntent transitions into requires_action. This parameter is intended for simpler integrations that do not handle customer actions, like saving cards without authentication.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.Mandate
member.summary: ID of the mandate to be used for this payment.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, or compatible Source object) to attach to this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodData
member.summary: If provided, this hash will be used to create a PaymentMethod. The new PaymentMethod will appear in the payment_method property on the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use. If this is not provided, defaults to ["card"].

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to. If receipt_email is specified for a payment in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate or cancel their payment on the payment method's app or site. If you'd prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme. This parameter is only used for cards and other redirect-based payment methods.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA.
If setup_future_usage is already set and you are performing a request using a publishable key, you may only update the value from on_session to off_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentConfirmOptions.UseStripeSdk
member.summary: Set to true only when using manual confirmation and the iOS or Android SDKs to handle additional authentication steps.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.CaptureMethod
member.summary: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account. One of: automatic, or manual.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Confirm
member.summary: Set to true to attempt to confirm this PaymentIntent immediately. This parameter defaults to false. When creating and confirming a PaymentIntent at the same time, parameters available in the confirm API may also be provided.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Customer
member.summary:
ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.
If present in combination with setup_future_usage, this PaymentIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ErrorOnRequiresAction
member.summary: Set to true to fail the payment attempt if the PaymentIntent transitions into requires_action. This parameter is intended for simpler integrations that do not handle customer actions, like saving cards without authentication. This parameter can only be used with confirm=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Mandate
member.summary: ID of the mandate to be used for this payment. This parameter can only be used with confirm=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.MandateData
member.summary: This hash contains details about the Mandate to create. This parameter can only be used with confirm=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID for which these funds are intended. For details, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary:
ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, or compatible Source object) to attach to this PaymentIntent.
If neither the payment_method parameter nor the source parameter are provided with confirm=true, source will be automatically populated with customer.default_source to improve the migration experience for users of the Charges API. We recommend that you explicitly provide the payment_method going forward.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.PaymentMethodData
member.summary: If provided, this hash will be used to create a PaymentMethod. The new PaymentMethod will appear in the payment_method property on the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use. If this is not provided, defaults to ["card"].

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to. If receipt_email is specified for a payment in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.ReturnUrl
member.summary: The URL to redirect your customer back to after they authenticate or cancel their payment on the payment method's app or site. If you'd prefer to redirect to a mobile application, you can alternatively supply an application URI scheme. This parameter can only be used with confirm=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA. One of: off_session, or on_session.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: For non-card charges, you can use this value as the complete description that appears on your customers’ statements. Must contain at least one letter, maximum 22 characters.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.StatementDescriptorSuffix
member.summary: Provides information about a card payment that customers see on their statements. Concatenated with the prefix (shortened descriptor) or statement descriptor that’s set on the account to form the complete statement descriptor. Maximum 22 characters for the concatenated descriptor.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.TransferData
member.summary: The parameters used to automatically create a Transfer when the payment succeeds. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies the resulting payment as part of a group. See the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentCreateOptions.UseStripeSdk
member.summary: Set to true only when using manual confirmation and the iOS or Android SDKs to handle additional authentication steps.

member.summary: IBAN of the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsBancontactOptions.PreferredLanguage
member.summary: Preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that the customer is redirected to. One of: de, en, fr, or nl.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Setting to true enables installments for this PaymentIntent. This will cause the response to contain a list of available installment plans. Setting to false will prevent any selected plan from applying to a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsOptions.Plan
member.summary: The selected installment plan to use for this payment attempt. This parameter can only be provided during confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Count
member.summary: For fixed_count installment plans, this is the number of installment payments your customer will make to their credit card.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Interval
member.summary: For fixed_count installment plans, this is the interval between installment payments your customer will make to their credit card. One of month.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardInstallmentsPlanOptions.Type
member.summary: Type of installment plan, one of fixed_count.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.CvcToken
member.summary: A single-use cvc_update Token that represents a card CVC value. When provided, the CVC value will be verified during the card payment attempt. This parameter can only be provided during confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Installments
member.summary:
Installment configuration for payments attempted on this PaymentIntent (Mexico Only).
For more information, see the installments integration guide.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Moto
member.summary: When specified, this parameter indicates that a transaction will be marked as MOTO (Mail Order Telephone Order) and thus out of scope for SCA. This parameter can only be provided during confirmation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.Network
member.summary: Selected network to process this PaymentIntent on. Depends on the available networks of the card attached to the PaymentIntent. Can be only set confirm-time. One of: amex, cartes_bancaires, diners, discover, interac, jcb, mastercard, unionpay, unknown, or visa.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic or any. If not provided, defaults to automatic. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, or automatic.

member.summary: If this is a bancontact PaymentMethod, this sub-hash contains details about the Bancontact payment method options.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsOptions.SepaDebit

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsOxxoOptions.ExpiresAfterDays
member.summary: The number of calendar days before an OXXO voucher expires. For example, if you create an OXXO voucher on Monday and you set expires_after_days to 2, the OXXO invoice will expire on Wednesday at 23:59 America/Mexico_City time.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsP24Options.TosShownAndAccepted
member.summary: Confirm that the payer has accepted the P24 terms and conditions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsSepaDebitOptions.MandateOptions
member.summary: Additional fields for Mandate creation.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentPaymentMethodOptionsSofortOptions.PreferredLanguage
member.summary: Language shown to the payer on redirect. One of: de, en, es, fr, it, nl, or pl.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferDataOptions.Amount
member.summary:
The amount that will be transferred automatically when a charge succeeds. The amount is capped at the total transaction amount and if no amount is set, the full amount is transferred.
If you intend to collect a fee and you need a more robust reporting experience, using application_fee_amount might be a better fit for your integration.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentTransferDataOptions.Destination
member.summary: If specified, successful charges will be attributed to the destination account for tax reporting, and the funds from charges will be transferred to the destination account. The ID of the resulting transfer will be returned on the successful charge's transfer field.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Amount
member.summary: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent. A positive integer representing how much to charge in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a zero-decimal currency). The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency. The amount value supports up to eight digits (e.g., a value of 99999999 for a USD charge of $999,999.99).

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.ApplicationFeeAmount
member.summary: The amount of the application fee (if any) that will be requested to be applied to the payment and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. The amount of the application fee collected will be capped at the total payment amount. For more information, see the PaymentIntents use case for connected accounts.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Customer
member.summary:
ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.
Payment methods attached to other Customers cannot be used with this PaymentIntent.
If present in combination with setup_future_usage, this PaymentIntent's payment method will be attached to the Customer after the PaymentIntent has been confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethod
member.summary: ID of the payment method (a PaymentMethod, Card, or compatible Source object) to attach to this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethodData
member.summary: If provided, this hash will be used to create a PaymentMethod. The new PaymentMethod will appear in the payment_method property on the PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethodOptions
member.summary: Payment-method-specific configuration for this PaymentIntent.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.PaymentMethodTypes
member.summary: The list of payment method types (e.g. card) that this PaymentIntent is allowed to use.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to. If receipt_email is specified for a payment in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentIntentUpdateOptions.SetupFutureUsage
member.summary:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with this PaymentIntent's payment method.
Providing this parameter will attach the payment method to the PaymentIntent's Customer, if present, after the PaymentIntent is confirmed and any required actions from the user are complete. If no Customer was provided, the payment method can still be attached to a Customer after the transaction completes.
When processing card payments, Stripe also uses setup_future_usage to dynamically optimize your payment flow and comply with regional legislation and network rules, such as SCA.
If setup_future_usage is already set and you are performing a request using a publishable key, you may only update the value from on_session to off_session.

member.summary: IBAN of the bank account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodSofortOptions.Country
member.summary: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in. One of: AT, BE, DE, ES, IT, or NL.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodUpdateOptions.BillingDetails
member.summary: Billing information associated with the PaymentMethod that may be used or required by particular types of payment methods.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodUpdateOptions.Card
member.summary: If this is a card PaymentMethod, this hash contains the user's card details.

member.name: P:Stripe.PaymentMethodUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in cents representing how much to payout.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Destination
member.summary: The ID of a bank account or a card to send the payout to. If no destination is supplied, the default external account for the specified currency will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.Method
member.summary: The method used to send this payout, which can be standard or instant. instant is only supported for payouts to debit cards. (See Instant payouts for marketplaces for more information.). One of: instant, or standard.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.SourceType
member.summary: The balance type of your Stripe balance to draw this payout from. Balances for different payment sources are kept separately. You can find the amounts with the balances API. One of bank_account, card, or fpx. One of: bank_account, card, or fpx.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: A string to be displayed on the recipient's bank or card statement. This may be at most 22 characters. Attempting to use a statement_descriptor longer than 22 characters will return an error. Note: Most banks will truncate this information and/or display it inconsistently. Some may not display it at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.PayoutReverseOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonCreateOptions.Nationality
member.summary: The country where the person is a national. Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2), or "XX" if unavailable.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonCreateOptions.PersonToken

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonCreateOptions.PoliticalExposure
member.summary: Indicates if the person or any of their representatives, family members, or other closely related persons, declares that they hold or have held an important public job or function, in any jurisdiction.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonCreateOptions.Relationship
member.summary: The relationship that this person has with the account's legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonCreateOptions.SsnLast4
member.summary: The last four digits of the person's Social Security number (U.S. only).

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonCreateOptions.Verification
member.summary: The person's verification status.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.Director
member.summary: Whether the person is a director of the account's legal entity. Currently only required for accounts in the EU. Directors are typically members of the governing board of the company, or responsible for ensuring the company meets its regulatory obligations.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.Executive
member.summary: Whether the person has significant responsibility to control, manage, or direct the organization.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.Owner
member.summary: Whether the person is an owner of the account’s legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.PercentOwnership
member.summary: The percent owned by the person of the account's legal entity.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.Representative
member.summary: Whether the person is authorized as the primary representative of the account. This is the person nominated by the business to provide information about themselves, and general information about the account. There can only be one representative at any given time. At the time the account is created, this person should be set to the person responsible for opening the account.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonRelationshipOptions.Title

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationAdditionalDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationDocumentOptions.Back
member.summary: The back of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationDocumentOptions.Front
member.summary: The front of an ID returned by a file upload with a purpose value of identity_document. The uploaded file needs to be a color image (smaller than 8,000px by 8,000px), in JPG, PNG, or PDF format, and less than 10 MB in size.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationOptions.AdditionalDocument
member.summary: A document showing address, either a passport, local ID card, or utility bill from a well-known utility company.

member.name: P:Stripe.PersonVerificationOptions.Document
member.summary: An identifying document, either a passport or local ID card.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan is currently available for new subscriptions. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for plans of usage_type=metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum. One of: last_during_period, last_ever, max, or sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in %s (or 0 for a free plan) representing how much to charge on a recurring basis.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.AmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as amount, but accepts a decimal value with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of amount and amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in amount) will be charged per unit in quantity (for plans with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for plans with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes. One of: per_unit, or tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: An identifier randomly generated by Stripe. Used to identify this plan when subscribing a customer. You can optionally override this ID, but the ID must be unique across all plans in your Stripe account. You can, however, use the same plan ID in both live and test modes.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires billing_scheme to be set to tiered. See also the documentation for billing_scheme.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows. One of: graduated, or volume.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TransformUsage
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with tiers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanCreateOptions.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed. One of: licensed, or metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.FlatAmount
member.summary: The flat billing amount for an entire tier, regardless of the number of units in the tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.FlatAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as flat_amount, but accepts a decimal value representing an integer in the minor units of the currency. Only one of flat_amount and flat_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: The per unit billing amount for each individual unit for which this tier applies.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in %s with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTierOptions.UpTo
member.summary: Specifies the upper bound of this tier. The lower bound of a tier is the upper bound of the previous tier adding one. Use inf to define a fallback tier.

member.name: F:Stripe.PlanTierUpTo.Inf
member.summary: Use this value to define a fallback tier.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTransformUsageOptions.DivideBy
member.summary: Divide usage by this number.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanTransformUsageOptions.Round
member.summary: After division, either round the result up or down. One of: down, or up.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the plan is currently available for new subscriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the plan, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.Product
member.summary: The product the plan belongs to. This cannot be changed once it has been used in a subscription or subscription schedule.

member.name: P:Stripe.PlanUpdateOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this plan using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the price can be used for new purchases. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.BillingScheme
member.summary: Describes how to compute the price per period. Either per_unit or tiered. per_unit indicates that the fixed amount (specified in unit_amount or unit_amount_decimal) will be charged per unit in quantity (for prices with usage_type=licensed), or per unit of total usage (for prices with usage_type=metered). tiered indicates that the unit pricing will be computed using a tiering strategy as defined using the tiers and tiers_mode attributes. One of: per_unit, or tiered.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.LookupKey
member.summary: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Nickname
member.summary: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Product
member.summary: The ID of the product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.ProductData
member.summary: These fields can be used to create a new product that this price will belong to.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Recurring
member.summary: The recurring components of a price such as interval and usage_type.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.Tiers
member.summary: Each element represents a pricing tier. This parameter requires billing_scheme to be set to tiered. See also the documentation for billing_scheme.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TiersMode
member.summary: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based. In volume-based tiering, the maximum quantity within a period determines the per unit price, in graduated tiering pricing can successively change as the quantity grows. One of: graduated, or volume.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TransferLookupKey
member.summary: If set to true, will atomically remove the lookup key from the existing price, and assign it to this price.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.TransformQuantity
member.summary: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the billed price. Cannot be combined with tiers.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.UnitAmount
member.summary: A positive integer in %s (or 0 for a free price) representing how much to charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceCreateOptions.UnitAmountDecimal
member.summary: Same as unit_amount, but accepts a decimal value in %s with at most 12 decimal places. Only one of unit_amount and unit_amount_decimal can be set.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the product is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.Id
member.summary: The identifier for the product. Must be unique. If not provided, an identifier will be randomly generated.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.Name
member.summary: The product's name, meant to be displayable to the customer. Whenever this product is sold via a subscription, name will show up on associated invoice line item descriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary:
An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card or bank statement. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.
This may be up to 22 characters. The statement description may not include <, >, \, ", ' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceProductDataOptions.UnitLabel
member.summary: A label that represents units of this product in Stripe and on customers’ receipts and invoices. When set, this will be included in associated invoice line item descriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.AggregateUsage
member.summary: Specifies a usage aggregation strategy for prices of usage_type=metered. Allowed values are sum for summing up all usage during a period, last_during_period for using the last usage record reported within a period, last_ever for using the last usage record ever (across period bounds) or max which uses the usage record with the maximum reported usage during a period. Defaults to sum. One of: last_during_period, last_ever, max, or sum.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.Interval
member.summary: Specifies billing frequency. Either day, week, month or year. One of: day, month, week, or year.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.IntervalCount
member.summary: The number of intervals between subscription billings. For example, interval=month and interval_count=3 bills every 3 months. Maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks).

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.TrialPeriodDays
member.summary: Default number of trial days when subscribing a customer to this price using trial_from_plan=true.

member.name: P:Stripe.PriceRecurringOptions.UsageType
member.summary: Configures how the quantity per period should be determined. Can be either metered or licensed. licensed automatically bills the quantity set when adding it to a subscription. metered aggregates the total usage based on usage records. Defaults to licensed. One of: licensed, or metered.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Active
member.summary: Whether the product is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Attributes
member.summary: A list of up to 5 alphanumeric attributes. Should only be set if type=good.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Caption
member.summary: A short one-line description of the product, meant to be displayable to the customer. May only be set if type=good.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.DeactivateOn
member.summary: An array of Connect application names or identifiers that should not be able to order the SKUs for this product. May only be set if type=good.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: The product's description, meant to be displayable to the customer. Use this field to optionally store a long form explanation of the product being sold for your own rendering purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: An identifier will be randomly generated by Stripe. You can optionally override this ID, but the ID must be unique across all products in your Stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Images
member.summary: A list of up to 8 URLs of images for this product, meant to be displayable to the customer.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Metadata

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Name
member.summary: The product's name, meant to be displayable to the customer. Whenever this product is sold via a subscription, name will show up on associated invoice line item descriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.PackageDimensions
member.summary: The dimensions of this product for shipping purposes. A SKU associated with this product can override this value by having its own package_dimensions. May only be set if type=good.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Shippable
member.summary: Whether this product is shipped (i.e., physical goods). Defaults to true. May only be set if type=good.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary:
An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card or bank statement. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.
This may be up to 22 characters. The statement description may not include <, >, \, ", ' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. It must contain at least one letter.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Type
member.summary: The type of the product. Defaults to service if not explicitly specified, enabling use of this product with Subscriptions and Plans. Set this parameter to good to use this product with Orders and SKUs. On API versions before 2018-02-05, this field defaults to good for compatibility reasons. One of: good, or service.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.UnitLabel
member.summary: A label that represents units of this product in Stripe and on customers’ receipts and invoices. When set, this will be included in associated invoice line item descriptions.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductCreateOptions.Url
member.summary: A URL of a publicly-accessible webpage for this product. May only be set if type=good.

member.summary: Height, in inches. Maximum precision is 2 decimal places.

member.name: P:Stripe.ProductPackageDimensionsOptions.Width
member.summary: Width, in inches. Maximum precision is 2 decimal places.

member.summary: A list of up to 5 alphanumeric attributes that each SKU can provide values for (e.g., ["color", "size"]). If a value for attributes is specified, the list specified will replace the existing attributes list on this product. Any attributes not present after the update will be deleted from the SKUs for this product.

member.name: P:Stripe.SetupIntentPaymentMethodOptionsCardOptions.RequestThreeDSecure
member.summary: We strongly recommend that you rely on our SCA Engine to automatically prompt your customers for authentication based on risk level and other requirements. However, if you wish to request 3D Secure based on logic from your own fraud engine, provide this option. Permitted values include: automatic or any. If not provided, defaults to automatic. Read our guide on manually requesting 3D Secure for more information on how this configuration interacts with Radar and our SCA Engine. One of: any, or automatic.

member.name: P:Stripe.SourceMandateOptions.NotificationMethod
member.summary: The method Stripe should use to notify the customer of upcoming debit instructions and/or mandate confirmation as required by the underlying debit network. One of: deprecated_none, email, manual, none, or stripe_email.
